Reviews.Title: “Easy Walk to the Heart of Paris”
Reviews.Author: gdambra
Reviews.Content: The best part of this hotel is the location. It's basically right near Notre Dame Cathedral and a short walk to the left bank shopping areas. We were able to walk to the Louvre, and there's even a grocery store across the street. As for the hotel itself, it's old but in good shape. It has the old fashioned French look, you'll find a lot of red and gold colors in the building, it's felt a little like a cheesy mardi gras themed room. Breakfast in the morning is average. The front desk workers are very helpful, they'll even make reservations for you. They also suggested excellent restaurants (see my other reviews). I didn't like the fact that the hotel is down what I would call an alley, so try to get back early, it gets a little sketchy in the area late at night. Overall, I would stay here again because the hotel is clean, well run and you don't have to waste time to get out to the area attractions.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: cyprincess
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel in August of 2011 with my mother and sister and had a wonderful time. This hotel is in the very center of Paris which makes it ideal for busineses and leisure travelers alike. It is a one minute walk to the metro which makes the rest of Paris very accessible. It is also a short walk from some of the key sights in Paris such as Notre Dame, and the louvre. The accomodation is charming and the front desk staff was very helpful with any requests.

Reviews.Title: “Avoid any room facing the inner light well. Not Convenient, Horrible staff experiences.”
Reviews.Author: asianPrince-S
Reviews.Content: The hotel has lots of issues that I would like to share with other guests. We stayed in Room 507, over New Year's eve against our wish. I strongly suggest avoiding 501, 506, 507 altogether facing the inner light well if you have to stay in this hotel. 1. Inconsistent options, room availability on Tripadvisor search vs. hotel webpage: There are more rooms available and with or without breakfast options in their website, but, when you search through Tripadvisor.com, it will only show the twin room at a different price and no breakfast inc. options. Unfortunately, their hotel homepage was down for reservation at the last page, where you put the payment method. That is when I called and spoke with Olga in early December 2011. Although booked through booking.com for a twin room, at a higher rate, we could get the breakfast included, and she heard me about the bad reviews, and suggested to take the double room on a higher level, instead of the supposedly last twin room. It will have a good view, although located in the back of the main road. She also added that it would avoid the inner well-facing problem. The adjusted booking detail now was changed to the double bed room but, Olga still didn't add breakfast. I had to call around for 2-3 hours more to correct it myself. It was frustrating to talk with the hotel staff on this change. The night guy simply wouldn't help to write down my note for Olga. 2. the hotel in a derelict location, A wrong room given; breakfast very basic with a good service: 2-3 weeks before arrival, during the booking period, I had specifically requested a room that is, not a red-colored, but well-appointed, street-facing room on a higher floor. Instead, we were given a very poorly laid out red-colored room facing a tiny light well, facing the other two guest rooms 3-6 ft away(1-2m), which we can hear them talk, or see every move through the see-through curtains. And, the tiny room was further chopped with a separate toilet, with a separate shower/sink room. And, the lighting well was brightly-lit, mimicking the daylight, at night, and we could not keep the curtain open for ventilation concerned about the privacy and a theft issue. The hotel location itself is also not that great. in Lantier street, there is this old homeless guy throwing bottles to the pedestrian one night, and pissed on himself in public. And also the whole back streets were covered with trash and graffitti, these are signs of derelict and unsafe conditions. The nearby shops on main street(Rue du Rivoli) have only GAP, ETAM, H&M at best, and there is no coffee shop that stays open late or a corner shop that stays open all night in its immediate and visible proximity. The breakfast was of little variety. Croissants and coffee, grapefruit and orange juices were great, but the rest is just the basic ham, boiled eggs, muesli, yogurts, dried fruits, milk. Unless it is included, I would not suggest getting your breakfast here. But it definitely saved our time in the morning. And, if you show up after 9am, you might have to wait for another 15-20 min until the tables open up. These 2-3 kitchen staff are older and the most polite and efficient workers among others. Their smiles were the key elements that saved the breakfast experience not too shabby, in my opinion. 3. The safety box was not working: after reported, still not fixed: Although we heard enough of the notorious Paris Pickpocketting issues, we still had to carry our own passports and all the money with us. We couldn't report this safety box problem the second day as they were busy with other guests, and we would only return after midnight later. 4. staff blaming the manager, other staff, unhelpful and unprofessional: During booking in Mid December, I had to call the hotel for booking issues, mentioned above, a couple of times more, but the night staff(the tall Indian Guy) would not write down a simple memo for Olga, shouting that he doesn't speak English. He did. We further experienced, Olga blamed her hotel manager for not putting the accurate room availability on on-line booking sites when I spoke with her back in early December. I DID NOT HAVE TO HEAR HOW HORRIBLE THEY WERE TO EACH OTHER. 5. NO English TV Channel or its accurate guide available: There was a room guide binder in a drawer, but it didn't show CNN(the only English channel out of 10) at #8 as printed, and there was no English Channel available. So, TV was useless. 6. Poor Room lighting, poor closet space: They put two twin-set halogen landscape Search lights that are sharp to the eyes. The closet space was cramped and was not big enough for two adults with only two carry-on bags. 7. Hot, stuffy room temperature in the morning: Without any heating on, at around 9-10am, the room temperature felt like way above 80'F(25C). We had to get out of the room fast before sweating too much. 8. While Olga blamed others, another staff reacted with aggression: When I got a chance to see Olga, on the third day, which was the second morning, after the previous morning being impossible to approach her as she was busy with others, she instantly blamed the other front desk staff, Nichola, who gave us room 507, and, blamed us, and, I got put off from her over-defensive reactions without a clear and simple apology. In the mean time, this black maintenance staff with braided hair showed up, staring at me, ticking her wrist watch to suggest that I was taking too much time. Olga explained that after 11 am, this woman was to take the front desk shift, which I did not have to know, and still it was very inappropriate to tell me all the details (unprofessional). That was one horrible gesture that I had never experienced in visiting any hotel in the world. With frustration, I simply told Olga to fix the safety box. We left the room key, and I told her we would return at night and she had plenty of time to fix the issue and bring my complaints to the manager. 9. Nothing was done, room wasn't cleaned after reporting the issues! When we returned late that night, the room door has this "Do Not Disturb" sign out there, which we didn't put. Surprised, we even had to knock the door to see if the room was given to someone else and we were moved to another room. Then we found out that it was still our room but, nobody attended the room for cleaning, or for fixing the safety box. It was already 1: 30am, and there was only this night staff at the desk who previously yelled at me over the phone and would not help, and we decided to address it early in the next morning to the manager. I was too upset to sleep for half the night, waken up by the noise and coffee smell from the kitchen through this light well, I could not get back to sleep after 5am, getting so angry with the way they had conflicted with us and how our stay seemed to be ruined. 10. More aggression at the front desk, during the last morning; I stood at the lobby, from 7:50am till 8:20, waiting for Raquel, the manager, to show up. While I was talking to Nichola, the same black woman interrupted us and started to show her hostility, pushing Nichola away, as if he was a bullied child. Nichola was attentively listening to my list of experiences and I got upset to see what just happened. When I pointed out to her that the interruption was a very bad manner, she almost started the fight with me. 11. Raquel, the manager, defensively reacted, then apologized: Then, Raquel arrived, and, I insisted we should talk in a quiet area, but she seated us next to the breakfast area, where other guests could hear us. And, I addressed all the issues above. Raquel initially tried to react defensively, explaining that this was only a 3-star hotel and I should not expect 5-star hotel services. She was already missing the point after all. Just like Olga blaming others, Raquel tried to find good excuses. And, I stopped her and clearly mentioned that we should be the last ones complaining about the issues they could easily fix, some of which on a dime. Then, she seemed to listen. And, I clearly told her that I did not have 5-star hotel expectation, already learning that there are known issues from other reviewers on here, but, although I had tried to avoid the negatives from the booking time. it seemed the inconvenience of the room and dealing with poor or aggressive reactions from the staff will never be corrected and any tourist would not tolerate the issues we had. Showing aggression to the guests, Not fixing the safety Box, No English TV channel list, Forgetting Room Cleaning, Blaming the manager and the colleagues... I am trying to think if the experience would be different if we took a better room facing the street. No, I think they are not good for international travelers, yet. All this self-entitled attitude among them and poor upkeep of the room features, not hiring a broad-minded staff would only impale the guest experiences. And, to be honest, these are easy to fix when I think of other hotels we stayed in Paris or in any other parts of Europe. I just want to forget about this bad experience from my memories after posting this review on TA right away.

Reviews.Title: “Charming short-term stay”
Reviews.Author: Susang8184
Reviews.Content: I stayed here with my older daughter for two nights in early January before continuing on to a rental apartment on Saint Germain. Charming older hotel with traditional decor. Excellent central location between the Louvre and Tour St-Jacques, yet tucked out of the way and very quiet. Courteous staff. Expanded continental breakfast a bonus. The "superior" double room was still very small, yet adequate. Ours had a sort of medieval castle decor with beams and some prints from a completely different time period. Comfortable bed. The bathroom was a generous size, tho (no shower but an extra large tub) and robes and slippers were a nice surprise. There was a small tv anchored to the wall that we never turned on. The WiFi worked great. They cheerfully held our bags after checkout for a few hours. A fine, live-out-of-your-suitcase (don't make it too big!), stay fort his part of town.

Reviews.Title: “Completly red room !”
Reviews.Author: kris t
Reviews.Content: old fashionned on the 1st floor, completly red (see picture)! Otherwise clean hotel, good location,

Reviews.Title: “Cozy and quiet”
Reviews.Author: 731Melimelo
Reviews.Content: Very nice hotel well situated in the centre of Paris. Very quiet also, which is unusual for this part of Paris. The room is a bit small but it adds to the charm of the place. The building dates from the 1500! The desk is extremely nice. Breakfast is a standard buffet served in a well decorated room. Cant get a better location for the value in downtown Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely old fashioned hotel”
Reviews.Author: Stephane D
Reviews.Content: Very nice room, old fashionned but which fit perfectly with the idea of a romantic week end in Paris. Perfect location (even tough a little bit difficult to find) close to many activities (touristic with Notre Dame, shopping with Rivoli and bar/restaurants with le Marais). Staff very nice and helpfull.

Reviews.Title: “Charming hotel and great location”
Reviews.Author: Uma78Norway
Reviews.Content: I am usually a bit posh. At the same time, I can like things that are charming, cosy and down to earth. The Grand Hotel Dechampaigne, located in a building from the 15th century, is all that. It is something about the atmosphere that appeals to me. Also, the location is perfect. You find the hotel in a small and very quiet street, Rue Jean Lantier, very close to the Chatelet tube station and one of the city's main streets; Rue de Rivoli. Chatelet is pretty much in the heart of Paris, in my opinion. The perfect location if you want to live in a central location. The Louvre, Notre Dame, Les Halles and Marais are within walking distance. The Opera district is close. This means that you are in the middle of major cultural sights and Paris' best shopping districts (Marais and Les Halles and Gallery Lafayette and Printemps in the Opera district). The beautiful river Seine is just around the corner from the hotel. Plus for free Internet acess, friendly and helpful staff (most of the time) and a very quiet room. The rooms were rather small, but that is very typical for Paris hotels. When checking out, they let me put my luggage in a room for six hours, so I could enjoy Paris for another day. I didn't try the breakfast, because there was such a nice restaurant and baker shop (boulangerie) just around the corner for the hotel. This time, I travelled alone, on a combined business an leisure trip, and I only had good experiences with the hotel, the area and the people of Paris. The hotel prices were also very good. The Grand Hotel Dechampaigne is not a place you go if you want to spoil yourself and indulge in luxury. But, it is the perfect place if you just want to relax, have a good time and spend your money on shopping and cultural experiences. It has lots of charm.

Reviews.Title: “An amazig find in Paris - love it!”
Reviews.Author: ABeachNelson
Reviews.Content: Perfect location near the Louvre, Marais, Notre Dame, Pompidu. Balcony rooms are well worth the price - not a view of anything particular but a lovely view roof tops. Rooms 503 - 505 have bigger balaconies, 502's is small but still nice. Rooms are quirky in architecture and interior design. All around a great place. This will be our hotel of choice for Paris. Excellent value. Wifi was slow though.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent once again”
Reviews.Author: janRotoruaNewZealand
Reviews.Content: We have stayed here twice now and would go back in a heart beat. Make sure you book the balcony room. Excellent location, walking distance to everywhere.

Reviews.Title: “Never disappoints”
Reviews.Author: travlife
Reviews.Content: This has been our Paris Hotel choice for over 20 years. It's location is the best. Steps from Chatelet and rue de Rivoli metro,and a two minute walk from Pont Neuf. We had a balcony,Garret room on the top floor. The room had all the amenities and the bed was very comfortable. Only complaint no English TV channel. Price is very reasonable and staff very accommodating. It is hidden on a back street so be sure you have it mapped. Highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Easy location and good value”
Reviews.Author: pinkysworld
Reviews.Content: My girlfriend and I stayed here four nights over the recent October bank holiday weekend. We found this hotel by search on TripAdvisor after realizing the other place we had booked was not at all to our liking, so we bailed at the last minute and took a chance on this wonderful gem of a place. It's very close (I'm talking just a few minutes walk) to the Metro, a fabulous neighborhood bakery and restaurants that were rated among the top 100 in the city. We ended up eating at two of these places over the 4 nights we were there and they were wonderful. I'm American but live in Europe. The rooms are small by American standards for sure, but that's not our priority. We just want a charming but comfortable clean room and bathroom with no hot water issues, along with helpful staff---and not for a lot of euros we'd rather spend on shopping and all the fabulous dining Paris has to offer. One really nice benefit is the hotel sits down a narrow alley away from the bustle of Rue de Rivoli and all that jazz. So while you are only steps away from the "scene" you are also away from lots of noise---so while there are the usual city noises to deal with---it's a lot tamer than what I've experienced in other places. Next time we are in Paris for a long city weekend we'll definitely be booking here again.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location!”
Reviews.Author: Chris D
Reviews.Content: Finding a great hotel for reasonable (by Paris standards) rates in the 1st. arrondisement is a challenge, but we loved this hotel and would return on our next visit to Paris. We had a room on the 1st floor facing the street and it was very comfortable, nicely furnished with a comfortable bed and large bathroom with tub and bidet. Pleasant surprise was the very quiet street right in the heart of old Paris! Charming lobby and breakfast room and friendly staff.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value for money”
Reviews.Author: Verhas
Reviews.Content: The hotel couldn't be in a better place, near the Island, L'ouvre, RER, Metro, everything. The staff was extremely helpful and kind, the room was a little jewel box with Wi-Fi. I would gladly book there again.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location”
Reviews.Author: Jim5911
Reviews.Content: Excellent location, quiet room, courteous and friendly staff, comfortable beds. This was our second time to stay in the hotel. We liked having a room facing the street.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Location!”
Reviews.Author: chgreen
Reviews.Content: This hotel is small on a wonderful quiet street only 2 blocks from the Seine! We were in room 305, I think. Room was small, but the bed was very comfortable. We were only in room for 3 night's sleep. Bathroom was on front of hotel and had a wonderful window that had a wonderful deep ledge to put all of our toilitries. Shower was also good with lots of hot water. I would go back to this hotel and would recommend it to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Nice place to stay”
Reviews.Author: lermndo
Reviews.Content: Stayed 2 nights in Sept 2011. Clean, comfy room-AC was powerful! Plenty of hot water, not noisy. Room was small with tiny bathroom. Still nice, though. Location is 2 blocks from Louvre, 1 block off the Seine, 4 blocks from Notre Dame. Perfect for us tourists. Would stay again. Front staff was fine-spoke light English and were courteous.

Reviews.Title: “Good choice!”
Reviews.Author: pearl08
Reviews.Content: Great location, being close to several attractions so that we could walk everywhere. Friendly and helpful staff. The room was clean and comfortable. Tucked away so noise from main streets were not a problem. Great cafes close by. Very comfortable and pleaseant stay.

Reviews.Title: “Charming hotel in excellent location by the river Seine”
Reviews.Author: PeterEdwards17
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed here August 2011. The rooms were beautiful and the hotel has antique furniture adding to the ambience - the hotel is several centuries old. The location is ideal, very close to the river Seine and the Ile de France, but tucked away in a quiet back street where you are not disturbed by noise. The staff were polite and helpful and the price was very reasonable for the comfort on offer. We wouldn't hesitate to go back.

Reviews.Title: “well placed not so expensive but good hotel”
Reviews.Author: mike_3579
Reviews.Content: This hotel is good value and right in the heart of the city. Small rooms but clean and comfortable.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic and will be back!”
Reviews.Author: Suzie S
Reviews.Content: This hotel was fantastic! There were 4 of us on our trip and it was extremely hard finding a hotel that allowed 4 people in a room. We stayed in the junior suite which was perfect for the four of us: myself and husband; sister and niece. The suite was split into 2 separate sections allowing us all to have our privacy. In addition, there was a toilet and sink in the area with the two twin beds so there was no crossing over when they had to use the bathroom, except for showering of course. The room had a fridge and tons of storage. After 2 weeks in different country's and Hilton hotels it was a pleasure to come here to a comfortable bed and an amazing AC!! The location was fantastic: a short walk to Notre Dame, Louvre, Concorde, and Arc, and right by the Metro to hop on a short ride to the Eiffel Tour. We did not do the breakfast but hit many cafe's in walking distance which were also fantastic and very welcoming. The hotel is in a fantastic tourist area with shops, cafe's, and grocery stores right by; we felt very comfortable walking around at all hours. We enjoyed our short time in Paris and are excited to go back and visit and will plan to stay in this hotel again. You will love it!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, excellent service”
Reviews.Author: Pete H
Reviews.Content: I don't normally write reviews. Not only was the hotel a great find in a great location, the staff were excellent rhoughout our stay and when i left my credit card in the room, they made the effort to find it for me and post it to me in London after i had left. For me that's excellent service. My room was small, however, it was clean and well appointed and frankly, on a city-break i don't really need a big room. Couldn't recommend it highly enough!

Reviews.Title: “Good value and location”
Reviews.Author: LovestoTravel919
Reviews.Content: We chose this hotel after the original hotel we booked had to cancel our reservaton due to a fire. That hotel was in the Latin Quarter which we usually prefer. This hotel is on the right bank but just across the bridge from the Latin Quarter so it was just a short walk to get there. It was just two blocks from the Siene and close to several metro stops and restaurants (but also on a quiet street so no problem with noise at night and trying to sleep). We were very happy with the location. The staff was also very friendly and helpful. The room was fairly small (which we expected and are used to) but the bed was big - queen size I think, which was a nice plus. The bed actually took up most of the room but there was good closet space. The decor was a little unusal - a large face of a lady from what looked like the 1920's was painted on the wall above the bed and blue sheer curtains came down from the ceiling on that wall and were draped on either side of the face. Heavy blue velvet curtains were on the window and closet. Once we got used to it, we thought it was quaint, added to the charm of the hotel and was definitely unique.

Reviews.Title: “Short stop in Paris”
Reviews.Author: Lopeyjo
Reviews.Content: I was on a Mother Daughter (she was 11) to realise her dream of climbing the Eiffel Tower. We were only in Paris for three days and I wanted a budget stay in the heart of Paris. This place fit the bill perfectly. It's location is fantastic. Close to Metro, Rail, Shopping, Left Bank, Major tourist centres. We were close to the overland train for Eurodisney and Eurorail. The hotel is in an alley, so it did take us a couple of wrong turns before we found it but when we did we were set. You can walk out the front door and go in one direction one block to the Seine right across from the Left Bank and Notre Dame and the other direction for the Rue de Rivoli and all the major shopping areas. The accommodation itself is snug but extremely comfortable. We had access to inhouse WiFi and the staff were incredibly helpful. We had our own bathroom and the place was clean. If you want a room that you can spread out in this is not for you. It's an ancient building and like a lot of rooms in Paris, they are small but for a short stop in Paris it was ideal. My daughter loved the lavish decor. We had the purple room and she was delighted. In house continental breakfast was available for a small fee but we didn't use it. With access to the centre of Paris there was plenty of other options and we preferred to hit the streets and find something else. One morning a curbside cafe with a full breakfast, another day a coffee and chocolate croissant at the McDonalds around the corner. There are lots of restaurants in the area to choose from for dinner as well. The best thing for me was the price. I was on a budget and pre paid on their website for a very reasonable price. Much cheaper than the chain hotels in the area and with much more character! .

Reviews.Title: “Great location and really enjoyed stay”
Reviews.Author: Graeme1951
Reviews.Content: Stayed in a triple room for four nights. A very nicely decorated hotel in styles to suit the age and character of the building (1560s). The room was most comfortable and very clean as was the ensuite bathroom. Bed linen and towels were changed daily. The staff were very helpful and printing off documents for my daughter and such like was no problem. The location is hard to beat being so close to the Châtelet metro station and less than 10 minutes walk from the Châtelet Les Halles RER. Would definitely go back if visiting Paris in the future.

Reviews.Title: “A very French experience in a great central location”
Reviews.Author: Jusgar67
Reviews.Content: This was a very French hotel, a nice clean exterior and lobby with comfy seating area leading onto the breakfasting room. Our room was on the first floor next to the lift, and we had paid for inter-connecting rooms. You enter through one main door, then each room is opposite each other separated by another door. One room had a double bed facing out onto the residential side street, the other two single (for the children) facing internally, all the beds were very comfortable and clean. Both rooms had adequate shower rooms with hairdrier, large mirror, toiletries fresh towels most days and maid service daily (rooms tidied, bins emptied, bathrooms cleaned and beds made - very nice touch). The air conditioning was the usual wall mounted, which are always a little noisy, but once the rooms were cool at night, we switched them off for bed so not a problem at this time of the year. Although this hotel is just off the Rue De Rivoli it was set in a residential area so the nights were quiet. There is a little supermarket around the corner from the hotel which was great for stocking up on late night snacks or lunch items for during the day, as Paris is very expensive, and saved us quite a bit of cash. The breakfast area was cosy, and at times busy, but the service was very good and the tables were cleared quickly with a wide continental selection including pastries, breads, fruit, preserves, eggs, cheese and fruit juices,which were replenished regularly so there was always enough fresh produce available for everyone. The waiting on staff served tea/coffee/hot chocolate to the table. The only issue we had, was that there were no tea and coffee making facilities in the rooms which would have cut down on costs dramatically as it was expensive to order tea/coffee/chocolate in the Hotel's small bar. The location of this hotel was excellent and after posting requests for direction help on the Tripadvisor forum before we left (thank you to those who posted and encouraged us to use public transport), we decided to brave the RER and arrived at the hotel within 35 minutes (make sure you get the most direct RER from Charles de Gaulle) after getting off the train, it was more difficult to get out of the station than it was to find the hotel, and we were amazed at just how close it was to the Metro. Anywhere we wanted to travel, if we were unsure, we just asked the reception staff at the hotel and the were excellent at advising on the best route. From our hotel either on foot or on the metro, we visited the Eiffel Tower, Sacre Coeur, Pompidou Centre, La Defense, Louvre, Notre Dame, several trips to the Pont Neuf which was just around the corner from our hotel with a great view of the Isle de la cite, followed by a couple of bus tours (day and night - definitely recommended) and the boat tour. We would definitely recommend the day bus and night bus tours, there are a few operators but we used open top sight seeing and booked the tickets in person at their tourist office on the Isle de la cite (ask at the Hotel for directions - I've forgotten the address!). Overall, we all had a great relaxing time in this hotel, and the staff were all very helpful, it was great having the free wi-fi especially for the kids!

Reviews.Title: “If you're not familiar with Paris and Parisians...”
Reviews.Author: squirrelly14
Reviews.Content: Minuses: Staff indifferent. The rooms are very old, you will be awakened during the night-advise you to bring a white noise machine. The bath and shower are tiny. The lock on the door didn't work well. Internet spotty. Elevator tiny-used stairs except for bringing luggage as it was circular. Pluses: Room was clean. Breakfast was croissant and coffee. Walk to Louvre. Not cheap for the type of stay you will have (lack of sleep and unhelpful staff) but perhaps typical of location?? If you enjoy camping or staying at hostels, this would probably be acceptable but if you've stayed at any type of hotel above a Days Inn, this will hurt.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, charming room, we'll be back”
Reviews.Author: principessa320
Reviews.Content: Perfect location for walking to major sites including the louvre, the musee d'orsay, and notre dame. Our room was charming - small but perfectly clean and had everything we needed. The staff was great - one receptionist even printed out a google map with directions on how to find a restaurant when we were in a rush. Overall, this hotel is a bargain. Next time we go to Paris we'll probably stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Modest, clean, great location in Paris with great people"”
Reviews.Author: huldawoman
Reviews.Content: Three friends stayed here in late May. The weather was perfect. This hotel was only 4 blocks from Notre Dame and the Louvre on a quiet back street (it's a bit disorienting the first day to find it). We had one room with a queen and single bed - it was small but good enough space and a rare find in Paris. Everything was clean, which is again difficult in old buildings. The staff was very friendly and helpful. Olga and the gentleman weekend front desk manager, whose name I unfortunately did not obtain, were just the friendliest and most helpful people. With the valuation of the $ to the Euro so low everything you can do to cut your costs is helpful. It is right near the Chatelet Metro and the Seine for easy walking to many major attractions.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location for walking tours in the city center”
Reviews.Author: RomanDyablov
Reviews.Content: Due to hotel's location we had an opportunity to reach most of the attractions on foot. There was no a great Paris view from the balcony, but actually my wife and I were so exhausted that didn't look at the window at all :) Nice match for a couple: small and clean room, good breakfast and exceptional location.

Reviews.Title: “Second stay confirms first impression -- great hotel!”
Reviews.Author: RWCreswell
Reviews.Content: Had a great 5-night stay in 2010; returned for a longer stay in May, 2011. All the wonderful features of this hotel -- helpful staff, well-maintained and clean rooms, comfortable bed, charming decor, and great location -- had not changed. Location is an easy walk to the Louvre & Orsay, Notre Dame & St. Michele & Les Halles -- just 1/2 block off Rue de Rivoli (but avoids the traffic noise) and 1 block from the Seine. Just as good, Chatelet metro station is 1/2 block away and connects you to Montparnasse, Montmartre, Rolland Garros, or even (by RER) to Charles DeGaule or Versailles. Great restaurants, bakery, shops, supermarket all within 5 minutes. We have now stayed in a 5th floor balcony room and a 4th floor superior room and, for us, the added ambiance is worth the price and/or adjusting your travel dates to get a balcony room -- a little larger (still small), but with fridge, tea kettle, and b'fast table; feels more like home. Definitely going back to this hotel next year.

Reviews.Title: “A fantastic central location priced very reasonably for Paris!”
Reviews.Author: Elena_0505
Reviews.Content: My husband and me have spent 2 fabulous weeks in Grand Hotel Dechampaigne. The hotel staff were friendly & helpful, always finding a time to chat and give advice. We especially want to thank receptionist Olga who was extremely welcoming, polite and helpful. The security parking is just two minutes by walk and costs about 23 euro per day. The Hotel works with this parking for a long time so its visitors have a discount for parking. The decor of the Hotel and rooms was very french, elegant and perfectly outfitted. So you can easily soak up the atmosphere of Paris. The street was relatively quiet, so we opened the window often and had a nice breakfasts at the balcon of mansarda. The room was lovely! It's "petit" but for Paris it's a good size and both of us had a plenty of room and storage space. The room comes with everything necessary: hairdryer, products, kettle, safe etc. The bed was very comfortable, a bathroom was new and clean. By the way everyday Cleanliness is perfect!!! Free High-Speed Wi-Fi was complementary during our stay (ask for a code at reception). Just near there is a great boulangerie, fromagerie, patisserie and little market that has a fruits, wines, water and anything else you might need. And of course sights and attractions are everywhere around you! We had a wonderful stay in this charming Hotel. Overall, we would definitely recommend this Hotel. It is a comfortable, luxury Hotel for half the price. It is located in the heard of Paris and we are going to stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Decent room,super location, friendly staff,avoid "superior" room”
Reviews.Author: BobFromLA
Reviews.Content: Clean, small rooms, quiet, helpful friendly staff. Can't beat the location, two minute walk to the Chatelet metro, the most central in Paris. At $230 for a standard room, $260 for a "superior" room, no bargain. I'd stay there again in a standard room--our "superior" room was $30/day more than a standard room that seemed just the same size and amenities.

Reviews.Title: “Superb choice for a tourist”
Reviews.Author: tiklaima
Reviews.Content: 5-10 minutes walk to the major tourist atractions. Friendly well informed staff. Central, but very quiet. An old building with recorded history and a lot of character. Some rooms even have real Paris style small balconies-terasses. Good beds and bathrooms. Perfect for a city break with family or friends

Reviews.Title: “A charming hotel in a great location with wonderful staff and amenities”
Reviews.Author: TH1Ann
Reviews.Content: I loved the Grand Hotel Dechampaigne, as did my family. It is a lovely well-maintained historic building in a quiet area of the city, but within walking distance of the Louvre and Notre Dame Cathedral and two blocks from the Seine. The staff was extremely friendly and helpful, the breakfasts were wonderful, WiFi was available, and the rooms were nicely appointed. The rooms were small, especially the bathrooms and showers, but they were charming and very clean. (I would only suggest that they be better stocked with soap.)

Reviews.Title: “A Paris delight”
Reviews.Author: RodandKaren
Reviews.Content: The location in Chatalet [near the Seine and the Louvre] is great for visitors. Metro station round the corner and the Gare Lyon not far away; plenty of restaurants nearby [try le Zimmer]. Staff very helpful esp for those of us with minimal French. Breakfast is good. Rooms are nicely furnished [lots of colour and velvet] clean and adequate although not huge in size. The bathroom was good, with plenty of towels and well ventilated. Our room had a small balcony.The free Wifi was just adequate for Skype - it would not be enough for a business user. We will definately stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “perfect location, lovely rooms, great staff, excellent value”
Reviews.Author: mark9662
Reviews.Content: stayed a full week - could not have asked for better. Staff is friendly and helpful. Hotel is tucked away on a quiet, untraveled street just steps from many sights, cafes, Seine, etc. highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect”
Reviews.Author: spabraathen
Reviews.Content: If you are going to Paris, stay at this hotel !!! Nice price, good location, nice english-talking staff, clean rooms, good beds

Reviews.Title: “Wedding Night”
Reviews.Author: sky_777
Reviews.Content: In the morning we had exchanged vows of love and fidelity in our home sity and in early evening we already was unpacking our baggage in this hotel room. So night we spent there was our wedding night. And i may say it was romantic. Helpful staff, small (it's a center of Paris after all) but comfortable room, tasty breakfast and really great view from from balcony. In the past we liked to live in this particular area of Paris so we lookin' specifically for a place not only with suitable price but with convenient location too. Do not you agree that located next to the subway AND at the same time quiet hotel is a good variant? The nearest station to this hotel is Châtelet – Les Halles, major interchange station from which opened easy access any area of the city. Perhaps I can recommend this hotel to everybody who is looking more for atmosphere and great impressions.

Reviews.Title: “We were thrilled with this hotel, staff, room, breakfast, location...”
Reviews.Author: merrymi
Reviews.Content: My sister and I (both 70 years plus) stayed September 2010. She had never been to Europe and I hadn't been in Paris in 49 years. We both like to arrange our own tours and like to walk. Our preference is small European hotels to meet travelers from different parts of the world. We had a balcony room (we love our outdoors) and it was covered with geraniums. It was gorgeous, so very French. Breakfast was great. Wonderful breads, cheeses, meats, coffee. What else is there? The hotel personnel were lovely and helpful. There was a teak table and two chairs on our balcony, where we had coffee in the morning and cocktails in the evening, relaxing after a busy day touring. Walking distance to Louvre, Notre Dame, Seine. We used the metro which was very easy to navigate and nearby. Breakfast was wonderful. Everything was! We couldn't have picked a better place. Paris was wonderful, everyone we encountered was more than happy to help us with directions. Can't wait to go back.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful quiet small hotel”
Reviews.Author: Peripatetic-1964
Reviews.Content: Great location, close to major site and very very quiet. Helpful front desk staff. Good value for money. Highly recommend Brasserie Zimmer nearby for breakfast and dinner, and Duc des Lombard if you like jazz.

Reviews.Title: “Very pleasant hotel in perfect location.”
Reviews.Author: Crannock65
Reviews.Content: We were in Paris to visit Theatre du Chatelet and the Marais. The smallish but atmospheric and well equipped room and bathroom in quiet cul de sac was tranquil and perfectly placed. Everything was within walking distance and the complimentary New Year's eve champagne and canapes was very thoughtful. Recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel at great location”
Reviews.Author: Vilmosh
Reviews.Content: We were looking for a hotel that can take 2 adults and 2 kids in one room, and we wanted to stay in Marais or Latin Quarter. This hotel is at a very good location, although the actual street that it is in is run down. The hotel is well kept, the room is quite specious for Parisian standards. We had one queen bed in the room and two armchairs that unfolded into two single beds. Those single beds made a lot of squeaking noise. The staff is friendly and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “A Grand Hotel in Paris!!”
Reviews.Author: creativecatz
Reviews.Content: Delightful hidden gem of a hotel (tucked away in small alley), close to the Seine (two streets back), numerous restaurants (recommend Café Zimmer) and shopping district. We stayed four nights in late October in a triple room on the top floor of this beautiful converted Stonecutters mansion. No view but clean and comfortable. Easy walking distance to Notre Dame and St Chapelle and stopping points for hop on hop off bus/boat tours. There is a small lift (fits three people). Free internet and drink on arrival. We could not fault this hotel. However, we would not recommend the airport transfer service offered – we used it to get to the airport and it was a stressful way to end our visit (rainy day, driver running half hour late, others to pick up on the way to the airport – driver nearly took out a pedestrian on a crossing). Our arrival by taxi was simple in comparison, even in peak hour. Thank you to Olga, the helpful lady on the front desk who was happy to advise on local restaurants, sites, etc. We enjoyed our stay tremendously and would stay again!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great location, nice rooms, friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: alicew45
Reviews.Content: This hotel exceeded our expectations. It is in a great location - within easy walking distance of the Louvre and the Seine. The room was a good size, clean and had beautiful period decorations. The staff were very friendly and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: bernylloyd
Reviews.Content: Great location and balcony room was nice to have. Was not happy with anything else. Eooms very small and need upgrading. No extra anemities at all. Lift very small.

Reviews.Title: “perfect location, full of character, and lives up to it's name!”
Reviews.Author: drbarbara_murray
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in a perfect location in the quiet but central 'ancien' area behind the Louvre, close to Notre Dame, Les Halles and Chalet metro, The hotel has a lovely historic feel about it, with original 16th century beams in the rooms and tasteful decor.I shared a triple room with my mother and sister - there was plenty of room , and the bathroom was a reasonable size and the beds very comfortable. There is free wi-fi and a computer in the lobby for free access. The staff were very warm and helpful. The complimentary glass of champagne was a lovely touch, which we saved until just prior to our departure. My only suggestion is that a kettle in the room for self-service drinks would have been nice

Reviews.Title: “The perfect Parisian location”
Reviews.Author: Millennium T
Reviews.Content: A great place to stop enhanced by being in the near vicinity of metro Chatelet. We were up on the 5th floor with a balcony. The rooftop views weren't great but the room was only there to sleep in! The room although small was clean and tidy,bed was comfortable and easy to drop off to sleep! The shower, as mentioned in other reviews, was on the small side but we managed. As with many Parisian hotels the lift was small, probably more space in the Phoenix capsule! We were only a street away from last year but by going down a different road we found a whole new world, well bars/cafes,shops. Would we recommend the hotel, of course.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: eyre67
Reviews.Content: Small rooms. The bathroom was so small it was a problem taking a shower. And I booked a superior room!! I can only imagine how the standard rooms are. The location however is Great.

Reviews.Title: “Charming and great location”
Reviews.Author: cherrytea
Reviews.Content: Perfect for our needs. The hotel reminded me of staying in a relative's cottage: friendly, old fashioned, eclectic and comfortable. Sure the lift is tiny and the stairs are a bit wonky but it gives your stay personality! We were a double but were given a triple room - huge! Especially for Paris. All the staff were very friendly... providing us with ice, storing our luggage, answering questions, etc. The hotel is also right in the middle of everything: Louvre, Notre Dame, Left Bank, Marais, Les Halles, D'Orsay are all walking distance. Anything else can be reached by the major metro station right by the hotel. Still, since its off a tiny side street the hotel is pretty quiet. An earlier review mentioned that the hotel is down an alley... that is not really accurate. Streets are much smaller in Europe and we never felt unsafe (we being two young women). (Also free wifi! yay!) Our only complaint is that we didn't have a mini fridge. Anyway, highly recommended! Especially if you can get a deal.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful location and very nice staff!”
Reviews.Author: repe62
Reviews.Content: Perfect romantic small hotel for our 22.wedding day!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value, location and staff wonderful”
Reviews.Author: Aloysiusjesu
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 3 nights in late September. Hotel is brilliantly situated one minute from Chatelet Metro and Rue De Rivoli. Staff were first class and very helpful. Go for a superior room if you can - ours had luxury dressing gowns/slippers, huge bed and good space for Paris and unusually tea/coffee facilities. Breakfast not gourmet but has all you need (breads, cereals, ham, eggs, cheese, fruits and yoghurt and lots of it. Will definitely recommend to our family and friends and will return (hopefully soon). Bathroom nice but slightly cramped....Internet in foyer/reception very handy but staff were superb.

Reviews.Title: “Simply perfect!!”
Reviews.Author: Trugu
Reviews.Content: We have just arrived from our week of hollidays in París, staying at the champaigne hotel and we were very pleased with our stay thete. The location colud not be better, withing a walking distance of the major turistic places to visit and metro; also the staff, breakfast, rooms... Everything was great!! Definitively we would recomend it as the best choice in París

Reviews.Title: “This hotel was worth every cent!”
Reviews.Author: YoungInMind
Reviews.Content: Excellent reception, with perfect English spoken, and great assistance with problems. Comfortable rooms, with tea making facilities, but no teabags or milk, but shop a few yards away to buy your own. Lots of short and easy walks to The River Seine, The Louvre, shops and Restaurants. Metro, tour buses and boats a short walk away. Free WiFi, and use of the hotel computer was much appreciated.

Reviews.Title: “It was Ok”
Reviews.Author: dimitraAthens_Greece
Reviews.Content: The positive first: great location, friendly stuff, very clean. The negative: every day the same breakfast-not worth value at all. The double bed had a bent (unlucky the one who was sleeping at the right side). The room was quite small but i guess that happens in general in Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, friendly, helpful staff”
Reviews.Author: maturecouplex
Reviews.Content: The location could hardly be better in terms of convenience - two minutes from Place du Chatelet; the Metro; the RER train system;, the bridge to Notre Dame etc. Also it's onl;y a few minutes more to walk to the Louvre, the Tuilerie gardens, the Latin quarter etc. Finding it, as a stranger, is a little more difficult. If you are travelling from Paris CDG airport by the RER you will get off at the Chatelet Les Halles interchange. The nearest Metro stationto the hotel is Chatelet (at Place du Chatelet.) Although you can travel between the two by Metro (Line 4) you can also walk underground directly between the two. Whichever you choose, navigation using the signs is difficult and no one we asked seem to realise that Chatelet was a separate Metro stop or exit from the system. When you emerge at street level, unless you have downloaded a map from the hotel website, finding Rue Jean Lantier is also a problem. Many Paris maps don't show it (parallel to and between Rue de Rivoli and Avenue Victoria). Also, no one we asked had ever heard of it! We expected the room to be small (based on some web reviews) but we had booked a superior room that was amply big enough for a couple. The staff were all friendly and helpful. All spoke good English and the front desk is staffed 24/7. The carpet was a bit worn and stained but the cleanliness was otherwise good. We can't comment on the food because we always ate out to maximise our time there. Perhaps the decor could be upgraded - but the building does date back to 1563!

Reviews.Title: “Charming Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: houston0099
Reviews.Content: We stayed with our 17 yr old daughter in a quaint triple room on the 5th floor. While the room was very tiny, we had enough space for our 2 night stay. (Any longer might have been rather cramped). The hotel staff was very helpful and friendly. The location of this hotel is perfect - the area is very quiet and safe with lots of restaurants and cafes. Easy walking distance to The Louvre, Notre Dame, Latin Quarter, etc. We would definitely stay at this hotel again!

Reviews.Title: “Great but don't book a taxi!”
Reviews.Author: DaveyPez
Reviews.Content: Location fantastic - so easy to walk to many places and Metro anywhere else but so tucked away it was quiet (except for lift rumblings!). Very pleasant helpful staff. Great continental breakfasts. Room typically cramped for Paris and of course no proper shower (note to self: must explain to the French that the idea is that the water comes down from above!). Would use this hotel automatically for any next visit to Paris. Just don't get the hotel to book a taxi for you - that tripled the cost of our journey to the station, as €12 was charged before we got in the car.

Reviews.Title: “Thieves!”
Reviews.Author: sassibelle
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel far in advance of my June trip to Europe, and I was really looking forward to Paris and this hotel. Unfortunately, I suffered a serious injury and was medically unable to travel. I cancelled my hotel reservation April 2nd, 2010, well in advance of any penalty deadline. I used their online reservation system with the confirmation number given to me by the hotel.to cancel the reservation. Imagine my surprise when the hotel charged my card $165 dollars!!! They asked for a copy of the email, but of coarse, I don't have a copy because I used THEIR reservation system. I disputed via my bank, but to no avail. When the times comes that I am well enough to return to work, and subsequently plan another vacation to Europe, I will not be staying at this hotel. Next time I book internationally, I will book through a reputable travel company, not the hotel directly

Reviews.Title: “amazing central location- yet quiet and charming”
Reviews.Author: AJMKRC
Reviews.Content: We loved Grand Hotel Dechampaigne- A great location, and terrific staff. I had come back to discover something about paris that had somehow bypassed me in a previous visit- Charm! well this time it was found- walks along the Siene, the food, this hotel- all added to a great holiday in Paris. The Grand Hotel Dechampaine is in Chatelet on the border of the 1st arrondisment, within easy access to all major attractions and very handy to the Metro. A very quiet small street gives this a "village" feel and in a very busy town, a surpisingly quiet location. Really good choice of restaurnas and shopping around the corner. Theatres- again around the corner. the river- guess where, yep! my new Paris apartment would have to be right here. Get a balcony room on the 5th floor- not because it is large, but somehow, having a coffee on the balcony overlooking the window boxes of red Geraniums, the local rooftops and chimney pots just seems right in Paris.........

Reviews.Title: “The best unexpected surpise about hotels! It changed our leisure trip in Paris from good to great!”
Reviews.Author: vpop
Reviews.Content: The best unexpected surpise about hotels! It changed our leisure trip in Paris from good to great! From perfect location up to enchanting room, friendly staff was contributing to enjoying the hotel. Free Wi-Fi was very helpful; breakfast nice. We had a great time!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location-Good Service”
Reviews.Author: ladyshirley
Reviews.Content: The location for this hotel is great; it is less than a 30 second walk to a the Cafe Benjamin, which serves great omelettes. It is a 10 min. walk from the Louvre and 15 min. from Notre Dame. Our rate was 177.00 EUROS a night, which is about 60 EUROS a night too much for rooms in this hotel, considering their smallness. The lobby is small & the elevator/lift only holds 2 people and 1 suitcase at a time; also when using the lift, you have to hold the button in or the lift will go to other floors. They have a laptop in the lobby you can use but it disapperas as the evening progresses. They also have a "bar" in the lobby but it is so small, it shares its space with the check-in desk. Our first room was on the 3rd floor. The bathroom was pretty big but the room was small; they got that backwards!The room had a small, but ladies, if you use it, make sure your purse is tiny! They fridge & safe are hidden behing heavy velvet curtains. The room itself was small, very small. We did switch to a room on the 4th floor which had a tiny bathroom & twin beds. It was only marginal larger by maybe 1 foot. If you want room & the ability to walk around then your room, then stay somewhere else. But if you want location, this this is a hotel which is good for it. I am very picky about hotels but I would stay at this hotel again and I do recommend it..

Reviews.Title: “If you don't stay here, you're staying in the wrong place.”
Reviews.Author: adacouple
Reviews.Content: Excellent choice for Paris. Everything within walking distance, especially the Louvre, or by Metro. Makes for an authentic Paris experience. The staff was most accommodating and friendly. Breakfast delightful.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location & Staff”
Reviews.Author: SteveandTara2010
Reviews.Content: This is the place to stay in Paris. Right at the Chatelet metro stop, minutes walk to Ile-de-la-Cite & Notre Dame and Latin quarter. Right on the 69 bus line for easy access to museums and all points of interest. Staff were extremely helpful. 6 stories of rooms, but top floor is not accessed by lift. We requested a change of room and got instant service moving us to a ultra nice room on 3rd floor. We will be back for more!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great family run hotel, would realy recommend”
Reviews.Author: scoobydo-bedo
Reviews.Content: This is a small hotel with a friendly family run feel, located in a quiet back street right in the heart of Paris. It's a 3 min walk from Chatelet RER/metro, Pont Neuf, a 10- 15 min walk to Notre Dame and less than 10 mins to the Louvre in the other direction. As is typical for Paris the room sizes are small but our twin room was clean and comfortable and everything worked including the free air con (v quite) and safe. The room was serviced daily (incl clean towels) and as ours was located in the very centre of the hotel there was absolutely no road noise at all (even if it wasn't the hotel is on such a quite back street I don't think you would be disturbed). The reception staff are v friendly and helpful - when we had trouble with our safe (our fault for not reading th instructions properly - it worked fine when we did!!) they were very obliging. You can also leave your cases in the luggage room when you check out if you have a few hours to kill. We got a deal with breakfast included - it was the usual French fare (breads, fruit, cheese, meat, juices, tea/coffee) not a huge range but it was fine ....although the staff were a little slow at replacing things that had run out at times. Some other points to note, the lift is small (but it works!!) and if you get a taxi up to Guare du Nord be warened - it's expensive - it cost us 18 Euros!! (You can easily get there on the RER from Chatelet if you are mobile and able to handle your luggage). For tourists there is a small supermarket within 30 yards of the front door so you can stock up for the day there. We also did the open top hop on hop off bus tours - bought a 2 day ticket for 32 Euros each and did all 4 routes over the 2 days - a great way to see Paris and we thoroughly enjoyed it .. never had to wait more than 10 - 15mins for a bus and although they were busy people do get off so you can move upstairs if there is no space intially If you have stayed in Paris in 3 star hotels before you may know they vary greatly in their standards ...... some have nice reception areas but behind that are pretty run down and not that clean. This one is a real find, its clean, comfortable, quiet, friendly and in a fantastic location. I would strongly recommend it and would definately return there next time I am in Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Ok hotel, but don't recognise the very positive reviews”
Reviews.Author: Chris056
Reviews.Content: We arrived for our long booked two night stay, and were told that sadly our room was not available after all! Instead they had booked us into a hotel down the road (Hotel Louvre) for our first night and that if we wanted to stay at the Hotel Dechampaigne we'd have to check in tomorrow night. Their excuse for this double-booking: a story about a sick guest not checking out, which one would love to give them the benefit of the doubt about however they seemed very certain that the room would be free the next day, which if they really were sick how could they be sure of that. Hotel Louvre i think was overall a better option anyway although we did move back to Hotel Dechampaigne for second night just to see what it was like, and got a room that was fine, but pretty tired in terms of furnishing and didn't resemble the plush pictures on the site. But it was a good size room with a comfortable bed, which in Paris is a good start. Overall it's in an amazing location and that's what you're paying for after all, but a double-booking experience aside, this place feels pretty average and we certainly didn't recognise the very positive experiences below.

Reviews.Title: “Very friendly and great service.”
Reviews.Author: cyberfrits2000
Reviews.Content: Very tastefully renovated hotel, near the Chatelet metro station. Best ever super-queensize bed. Excellent buffet breakfast. Complimentary quality newspapers and internet in foyer. Fluent English staff reception desk. Exceptional service.

Reviews.Title: “Look for something else”
Reviews.Author: viaje12301
Reviews.Content: This hotel although it is located 1-2 blocks off of Rue du Rivoli and close to the Louvre, it is kind of in an alley. We arrived almost at dark after 7:00pm and after we checked in decided to look for a place to eat dinner. Our first impression on that night was two scary looking homeless persons tucked into a door way! We were three women traveling together, so I did not feel to safe at night. The hotel is small, tiny elevator, typical European - small. We had to get a suite because we were three persons, the room was very nice, clean, and spacious. The service was generally good. The last day when we had asked the front desk to call us a taxi to take us to the airport, we were shocked to find out that taxis start their meters running when they depart to the pick up place, in other words our taxi already had 18 Euros on the meter when she came to pick us up at the hotel! I asked the front desk to help me and defend me against this taxi driver that did not speak English and the front desk person - Ali said he could do nothing! The taxi driver charged us $94.00 for a ride to the airport, when we asked for help in reserving the taxi the afternoon prior, we were told that the ride would cost approx. $60.00! Taxi drivers also charge per suit case they have to carry in the cab, even though they never even touch the suit case!

Reviews.Title: “Location,location, location”
Reviews.Author: naplesjoey
Reviews.Content: The staff was great, especially Olga. The location is wonderful! The room was very tiny,but we know this ahead of time. Very romantic. Will stay again in 2010.

Reviews.Title: “Top!!!”
Reviews.Author: hannabre
Reviews.Content: very good!!! nice service, nice and clean rooms, perfect location!!!

Reviews.Title: “Good value for money, very helpful staff, great location”
Reviews.Author: RominaGaston
Reviews.Content: It actually was what we expected to be according to the reviews. We loved the location and are really grateful to the helpful staff. The only thing i'd improve is the shoer which wets all the bathroom floor no matter what you do to prevent it. but the room was nice, clean and warm, water hot. We would go back

Reviews.Title: “good value for money, good staff”
Reviews.Author: Alex_Sb
Reviews.Content: We family of 3, including 4-years old daughter, just returned home from Paris. We stayed 3 nights in Grand Hotel Dechampaigne, in triple room. No views from 2 windows, but it didn't bother us since we were coming hotel to sleep only. Mattresses could be better, otherwise no complains. Hotel located on very quiet street. No noise at all. Staff was very friendly and competent. Best value for money!

Reviews.Title: “Convenient, comfortable, hospitable”
Reviews.Author: parisgram
Reviews.Content: This is our second stay at your hotel. The location is so convenient to metro, walking each bank, museums, etc. Three of us were very comfortable in our room. The evening staff and weekend staff with whom we interacted the most were very helpful. Restaurants closeby are excellent - particularly the wine restaurant on the corner where we had a 3 course meal reasonable. Should we be blessed to return to Paris, we will definately stay with you. Mrs. Sandra Craig

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location, very comfortable, friendly hotel”
Reviews.Author: solotravller
Reviews.Content: Bit of a last minute trip and I couldn't have picked a better hotel. Not as glamorous as it looks online but I had a charming, quirky, very French room with an extremely comfy bed and - a must for me - a soft pillow, lashings of hot water, nice toiletries, towels etc provided. Lovely and quiet tucked away in a back street but a perfect location close to lots of shops, tourist sites and just one street back from the Seine - perfect for walking everywhere and I didn't need the metro although it's only 2 mins walk to a metro station. 4 stops I think from Gare du Nord or a 30 mins walk - which after sitting on the train for a couple of hours was fine. I'd certainly go back. The staff were very friendly, polite and helpful both by email before I arrived and throughout my stay. Didn't have their buffet breakfast - so can't comment on that !

Reviews.Title: “great location and friendly helpful staff”
Reviews.Author: cheryl200
Reviews.Content: I was in UK on business and couldnt resist a first time couple days in Paris via Eurostar. Googled 3 star + hotels near the Louvre and settled in on Grand Hotel Dechampaigne based on Trip Advisor reviews. The staff and facilities charmed me from the first. I arrived early - probably around 11 AM from the earliest London departure of the day. I was hoping just to drop my bags for a later check in, but was given a room right away. Clean comfortable room with free wifi. Pleasantly suprised to find evening turndown. The decor was certainly unique to anywhere I've ever stayed - brightly coloured padded frabric walls and original beams. The building dates to 1562! Everyone I encountered at the front desk spoke English and gave great suggestions for my short trip. I was able to leave my bags after checkout until my last departure of the day train in the evening. Walked everywhere - from the Eiffel Tower to Notre Dame. Special thanks to Olga and Laura for their extra time and attention. I hope to return to Paris and this hotel again next year.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent!! Strongly advise”
Reviews.Author: bennoPoole
Reviews.Content: This was our first trip to Paris, for our honeymoon. We were willing to push the boat out and were origionally looking at 4 star plus hotels in the Champs Elysees area, however my wife stumbled upon this hotel and we could not resist the savings and the look of the hotel and location. We obviously had reservations - what if it didnt live up to its marketing? Well it certainly did that! We booked a balcony room which gave us what we needed. Smaller than you would expect for a suite, but this is common in Paris and in most cities worldwide. It was about the size of a Premier Inn Room which was fine for what we needed and cosy. The location is absolutely superb, literally a stone's throw from the Seine and Notre Dame. To the North the Rue De Rivoli which is great for shopping and much cheaper than Champs Elysees. Far enough back from the river so very quiet! The decor is very old fashioned, which is what really makes this hotel, very parisian. The decor is in good order, clean and every room different. I could not get over how clean the hotel was from every aspect. We did not have breakfast at the hotel as we decided to try different places each day but it did look good. (go to the Latin Quarter for food and god nightlife, about 10 minutes walk over the river from the hotel) There is free WIFI and they even provide a laptop in the lobby for you to use at your convenience. You can also connect to their server if you are taking wireless laptop (good for I Player unless you like listening to false over dramatic american CNN reporters every morning with your coffee??) The staff were the finishing touch in this hotel, the friendliest and most efficient I have known in any hotel that I have stayed in throughout the world!! They all speak very good English, but I would advise having the courtesy of learning a few basic French phrases and using them, they will always return in English - this is good advice for anywhere you go, you will get better service. To sum up, the Grand Hotel De Champagne was certainly the best choice we could have made and we will certainly be staying here when we return.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent friendly hotel, great location”
Reviews.Author: Brighton Steve
Reviews.Content: Just had a great weekend in Paris staying at the Hotel Dechampaigne. Welcomed with a glass of champagne. Staying in one of the balcony rooms. Great views over the roof tops of Paris. Was the prettiest room I have ever stayed in and the bed was so comfortable. The free wifi worked very well, no connection problems. The location was prefect for sight-seeing. 5 minute walk from Chatelet metro, even closer to the Seine, and a short walk to the Notre Dame. In short I throughly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Friendy,clean, convenient, efficient, comfortable and good value.”
Reviews.Author: nevbcoupe
Reviews.Content: Very good value for central Paris, par ticularly convenient for the Museums and Les Halles shopping Mall.

Reviews.Title: “Made us feel welcomed and valued as a guest”
Reviews.Author: 534tan
Reviews.Content: The hotel was clean, the rooms were spacious, they offer free- WiFi and the staff could not have been nicer. They attended to any request and made us feel welcomed and treated us graciously. The location is excellent - close to major attaractions, great restaurants and shopping.

Reviews.Title: “Location and service!”
Reviews.Author: Anita1967
Reviews.Content: Can't beat the location, an easy walk to most of the sights. On arrival we were offered a glass of champagne which was a nice touch. Lift was normal Paris size - ie room for one but to be expected. We had a triple room which was small but perfectly adequate. We were on the 5th floor but don't expect a view with a Courtyard room which we didn't. Service was very good, very friendly reception and breakfast staff and all spoke very good English.

Reviews.Title: “MY hotel in Paris”
Reviews.Author: peacethroughtravel2
Reviews.Content: This is the second time we have stayed here and I will never stay anywhere else while in Paris. The location is central yet quiet, the rooms are elegant and have wifi, the bathtubs are huge and the windows open wide, the staff is very friendly, the breakfasts are wonderful and the value is terrific. If you like big cinder block american style motels do not stay here you will pollute it's very chic atmosphere.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: NatalieLV
Reviews.Content: Hotel is amazing! Very friendly and helpful stuff. Helps in all kinds of questions. Excursions, transports and place questions all were explaned in our language, big thanks to administrator Olga for that. Many, many thanks. Our next time in Paris we will stay in this hotel for sure!

Reviews.Title: “Very good all and all”
Reviews.Author: Virpi09
Reviews.Content: Had a very good short 4 days holiday in Paris in Hotel Dechampagne. Hotell staff is excellent and will help you in any matters. Rooms are quite small, but did not bother us, adult couple. Location is excellent as well, metro stations are in very close distance and Paris metro is very easy to use. Elevator in hotel is small too, but can be used with one to two person + 1 suitcase. If more luggage then go up and down twice. We loved the hotel atmosphire and will definately recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “wonderful week”
Reviews.Author: tbondurant
Reviews.Content: Our vacation could not have been better thanks to the wonderful staff. We stayed in a different room than before & it too was great. the Wi-Fi needs some work but everything else was just great. Thanks!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic little find”
Reviews.Author: KellyNorthumberland7
Reviews.Content: Having been to Paris many time over the years and always staying in the Latin Quarter we decided to try 'the other side of the river' for a change and I have to say we will use this hotel again. Its set back off the main street so fantastically quiet for sleeping (most hotels have traffic noise 24/7). When we arrived we were given a very warm welcome by the man at reception. As it was August the heat was terrific when we arrived but within minutes of turning on the aircon in the room it was like a fridge (very unusual in our experience of Paris) and very welcome. The hotel was located perfectly for a lot of the tourist attractions (10 mins walk to Notre Dame/Louvre,15 mins to Latin Quarter) and it was easily accessable from Gare du Nord on the metro as we had arrived by Euro Star. The hotel was very clean and we loved all 3 rooms we had booked especially the material on the walls instead of wall paper. We did not sample the hotel breakfast as we thought it was quite expensive and used the supermarket and Boulangerie round the corner. I have noticed that the last few reviews were from Americans who have obviously not been to Paris before and experienced proper old buildings. If you want a big room with a big lift then you should look for a modern big hotel. Most buildings in Paris are very old and have very small rooms, you have to remember they were not designed with lifts so these have been squeezed in where they can. I can highly recommend this hotel and we will book it again for any future stays.

Reviews.Title: “Very frustrating experience”
Reviews.Author: aspen_medium_rare
Reviews.Content: Based on the reviews of this property, I had expected it to be a cute boutique hotel, and I suppose it has a certain charm. But I never expected that it would be such an uncomfortable place to stay. The lone elevator is ridiculously small (seriously, the size of a telephone booth) and rickety, the internet service rarely works, the rooms are so small compared to the size of the beds that it is seriously difficult to even walk around the bed to get to the bathroom, the desk is so small that you can barely fit a laptop on it, the night desk clerk locks the door and proceeds to fall into a coma from which he cannot be roused, etc.. With 2000 hotels to choose from in Paris, and a couple of very nice ones in the same area, I can´t think of any good reason to choose the Dechampaigne.

Reviews.Title: “a "different" hotel. some ups, some downs.”
Reviews.Author: matchequeda
Reviews.Content: upon arriving at the hotel, we could not fit our luggage in the elevator, and the max capacity for the elevator was "3 people", though i fear that for americans the number may be different. the hotel may present some issues for people who are claustro or fat because of the small and low capacity elevator, narrow hallways, and rooms that are small even by european standards. the hotel is down a dark alley which has a distinctively bad smell. the way that it is nestled presents both pros and cons for its guests. the hotel is impecably quiet and very clean. the beds are nice. the showers are VERY cramped and the rooms are very small. some of them smell - popular smells include smoky and/or musty. the staff was very helpful and nice, especially laura at the front desk - however, they have little cosmopolitan knowledge and ended up making us a reservation at a restaurant where the average entree price was 75 euros - and my last name ain't rockefeller. also, most employees have limited english speaking skills, though i think this is pretty regular for paris. the neighborhood is sleepy and at night there is not a lot going on. there are a few restaurants and bistros around but it is no manhattan. nonetheless, the hotel enjoys a quiet environment where you can easily sleep without being disturbed. not sure if i would recommend it but if you can get a good rate and are okay with what it is, go for it.

Reviews.Title: “Unsatisfied guests”
Reviews.Author: BarrowDublin
Reviews.Content: My wife and I decided to book this hotel because of its location. On arrival we found our room small as expected, but it was supplied with the basics we needed and it was clean. Later that day after we had returned from a meal and some sightseeing we noticed that exterior walls blocked any sort of view from our room windows and to tell the weather we had to bend low close to a window or stick our heads out where, on looking up almost vertically, we could see a small portion of sky. We found this a bit claustrophobic and on the first night informed the receptionist of this and requested a different room. He said he'd inform the day staff who were empowered to do this. The following day we set off for Disney and had a nice day. On return that night we asked a different receptionist about our request and he said he'd also pass it on to day staff. I believe both these receptionists who were nice friendly people passed on our messages. On the third day, having received no reply, we decided not to let this spoil our holiday and to just enjoy our stay in Paris. Chatelet is a great location, with a huge metro station from where you can reach airports, Disney and most tourist attractions. There are other hotels and also appartments in and near this district which should also be considered. Had the hotel management informed us that no other triple rooms were available then we'd have been quite content with that, but we were deliberetly ignored which was a display of ignorance and unprofessionalism. We got out and about a lot and thouroughly enjoyed Paris

Reviews.Title: “Flat fee shuttle service scam”
Reviews.Author: fiddlewilltravel
Reviews.Content: If getting taken on the taxi ride from CDG Airport to the hotel was not bad enough (cost over $100), then the Flat Fee Shuttle Service rip off really sealed the deal that you will be chaeted out of money where ever possible. We arranged the flat fee service to return to CDG Airport on our last day. This service was advertised as 17 Euro per person in small groups (25 Euros for just one person). The hotel said that this would be a total of 34 Euros and we would have to leave the hotel an intial deposit in cash of 13 Euros and then only pay the driver the balance of 21. When the shuttle came to get us, they knew our name and where we were going. However, when we arrived at CDG, the driver pointed to the meter and said he fair was 54 Euros. I explained the arranged deal with the hotel and the driver said he knew nothing about it. We of course had no choice but to pay. We stayed with a close friend who was still st the hotel so we warned her about this. She had the hotel clerk specifically check to make sure she was getting in the right shuttle. Her story was identical to ours. When she arrived at the airport, the driver pulled the same con game and pretended to know nothing of the flat fee. She way over paid also. Please be warned! Make your own independent travel arrangements. Also the wireless internet may or may not work.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location and lovely deco, please helpful and friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: democritus
Reviews.Content: The hotel is conveniently located yet hidden from the crowd. Deco is beautiful and the staff ( esp Laura) are all very helpful and friendly.

Reviews.Title: “so quiet and friendly, but in the very center of Paris”
Reviews.Author: Quartier
Reviews.Content: Comfortable and very nice room, flexible and polite personnel, for the hotel situed just in the center of Paris, so close to everything that we could walk. Beside that, the station metro is really next to the hotel, located in a very quiet street behind the big trafic.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel with friendly personel”
Reviews.Author: maroechella
Reviews.Content: In one word lovely! Hotel is romantic and in a good location.

Reviews.Title: “A true Parisian experience”
Reviews.Author: llmDallas
Reviews.Content: We have previously stayed in apartments while in Paris, but we found this hotel to be a very good experience. The staff was effecient, cordial and very accomodating. The location was ideal for walking to the museums and Notre Dame. The air conditioning in the hotel was fastastic. The rooms are small as expected with European hotels build in older building. I would stay at this hotel again when in Paris for just a few days. LM--Dallas July 2009

Reviews.Title: “Maybe would stay again if I could get a better price”
Reviews.Author: freakyholiday
Reviews.Content: Booked a last minute trip to Paris, where we usually rent an apartment, but since it was last minute we had to find a hotel. Checked the reviews, seemed decent, we liked the location and we knew not to expect much when it comes to size for rooms in Paris. We had booked a double balcony room with a queen bed for 2 nights. We specifically booked the queen bed since my partner is 6'4". The room they gave us the first night was a double balcony room, but it only had a full bed. They said that the full bed was the biggest bed they had for a double, but we asked them about moving us to a room with 2 twins that we could put together to make a queen, but they had no rooms available since they were completely booked that evening. My partner didn't get any sleep that night, but we did move to a bigger room with balcony the next night that had the queen size bed. Much better room. When checking out they finally gave us a reduced price for the first night since we didn't get the room that we had booked.
