I guess the price is average for a hotel room in Paris, but you get much better deals with apartments. I did like that they had a computer in the lobby that was available and that they had free wifi throughout the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Parisian Hotel - A Real Treat”
Reviews.Author: 2adults2kids1dog
Reviews.Content: In celebration of my mum's 70th birthday, the two of us had a wonderful night in Paris at this gorgeous hotel. It is tucked away down a small side street or alley (depending which direction you approach from), making it a quiet retreat right in the heart of Paris. The staff were so warm and friendly and helpful - giving us a beautiful twin room on the 5th floor with a balcony overlooking the rooftops of the city. They knew it was a special occasion and knew we'd love the room. I even loved the teeny-tiny lift that took us up to the top floor. It has so much character. Indeed the whole hotel does. The continental buffet breakfast was lovely too, with a good selection and delicious croissants. But, of course, when you're in Paris you don't want to spend all your time in your hotel (tempting though it may be!) and the Grand Hotel Dechampaigne is in a fabulous location for exploring the city - a block from the Seine, short walk to Notre Dame in one direction or the Louvre in the other, or along the river banks to Musee d'Orsay, St Germain district or shopping on the rue du Rivoli, or around the Pompidou Centre. Everything is close by. We even walked to the hotel from Gare du Nord when we arrived on Eurostar - though chose to get a taxi on our way back as it was a v hot and sticky day. (It's a short hop in a taxi but a good 20-30minute walk on busy roads - so not the best with suitcases in tow). I hope I will have a chance to go back to the Grand Hotel Dechampaigne. It is a wonderful hotel full of Parisian character with staff, and an owner, who knows how to look after its guests very well indeed. Thank you to everyone at the hotel for a wonderful 70th birthday treat for my mum. I whole-heartedly recommend that you stay here if you can.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Hotel, Perfect Location, Exceptional Staff”
Reviews.Author: kj-yvr
Reviews.Content: We were two ladies visiting Paris recently and were very happy with our hotel choice there for one week. Racquel greeted us with a glass of champagne and made us feel so welcome. At first we expressed a little disappointment in our small twin room but didnt make a fuss. Got used to it in no time, but three days later - were delightfully surprised with an upgrade to a top floor room with balcony. Perfect! The service for the whole week was exceptional. Super restaurant recommendations and also arranged special events for us (tickets to a Vivaldi concert in Saint Chapelle). We would highly recommend this hotel. Thanks again to all the staff there! Karen and Laura

Reviews.Title: “take the doubt out of travel”
Reviews.Author: madhorse
Reviews.Content: like all paris hotels you seem to pay a high price ! rest assured that here you have a great location for RER or METRO (chatelet) .. the 1st and last day of a break with luggage can be a nightmare but just one straght line from airport to chatelet and then out of the barriers into the daylight !! room was 2nd floor very inviting .. seperate loo .. small bath/shower room .. nice decor .. very clean .. safe for valuables daytime staff very pleasant and extremely helpful especially last day when leaving .. needed to leave luggage in safe hotel baggage area while out on day excursion came back 5pm a smooth service no charges BIKE ABOUT TOURS a great way to put Paris centre in perspective with quality and extremely knowlegable guys .. you never know whats round the next corner !!!!

Reviews.Title: “Disappointingly backward - definitely avoid for business travel”
Reviews.Author: alella
Reviews.Content: I had booked the Dechampaigne (or "de Champaigne" - they seem to be inconsistent in how they themselves write it) largely based on the strength of the reviews here, for a fairly long-term business stay in Paris (19 days). I travel extremely often for business, with many years of experience around Europe, but had not needed to stay in this district of Paris previously. The property is in a surprisingly quiet alley right in the heart of things, very well situated. The hotel itself is of the "quaint" and rustic variety, but it is a reasonably pleasant place. The rooms are quite small, typical for older hotels in Paris, but attractively decorated. The front desk staff are reasonably friendly. The individually-controlled air conditioners work very well (I wish I could say the same of many larger establishments). So, to this point, good. And if you are looking for a place for a retreat from the world while on a personal vacation, and you have all the time in the world, and you are sure you won't have to deal with their management, by all means do book the hotel. If you want to be able to attend to business or keep to a tight schedule while there, forget it. Others have mentioned the tiny elevator (and even those familiar with smaill places in Europe will not imagine just how small until you see it) and in fact it was a concern for me that if I wanted to come or go quickly from the top floor the one elevator was pretty much useless, since it only really fit one person at a time so there would be a long and unpredictable wait at peak times). Also, taxi drivers seem unable to find the place down its rabbit-warren street, despite the 1st district central location. But the primary concern is the fact that their improvised internet system simply does not work. They seem to have a single slow personal-type DSL connection whicih they attempt to share/relay throughout the property, and most of the time it is completely dysfunctional. Clearly, the staff are used to seeing problems with this - before I ever brought the problem to their attention on the first night, the night clerk had already unplugged and restarted their little wireless router several times (apparently their only solution) trying to help another client who couldn't get a stable connection. I wasted many hours for the first 24 hours at the hotel trying to get a reasonable connection anywhere on the property with no luck. The night clerk offered to simply let me use THEIR laptop. It didn't connect either, or when it did occasionally, the connection was so ridiculuously slow (think the early days of cruise-ship connections) that pages would consistently time out before they loaded. The desk staff were apologetic about the problems, and helpful to the extent that they could be, but couldn't really do anything. And while the night clerk insisted that technical support would be called the next day, clearly that didn't happen. So, they don't have a decent communications infrastructure in the place, and aren't at all concerned about business customers - it is one of those places which clearly still sees internet service as a nice little extra rather than a critical basic service. I would assume that they would have responded more earnestly if, say, their water supply suffered simiilar problems. So, regrettably I had to leave to go to another establishment, since their hotel was effectively useless for me when I had to be almost continuously online to attend to business for three weeks. Here is where my experience got surreal. Even though I had to leave after 24 hours due to the problem with their services not working, and as a result, had to incur additional expense to book at walk-up rates at a more modern establishment, they subsequently have tried to hold me responsible for three nights' worth of room charges, despite the fact that the cancelation terms per my reservation were clearly stated to be 24 hours notice. And they even had the nerve to suggest that I should be pleased with their three-day charge, since they really should charge for five since it was to be a 19-night stay! It also took them two weeks after I left to get around to telling me this, despite repeated requests that they explain why a 600-euro charge remained on my credit card. So, their desk clerks may be friendly enough, but their management is just as unreasonable as they come. t regret, therefore, having to give this property a very strongly negative recommendation, and urge you to avoid it. It is a pity, because with a bit of refurbishment to improve their infrastructure, and new management witth a better customer-care attitude, it could be quite a nice place.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous location”
Reviews.Author: Galleonbeach3
Reviews.Content: I took my two daughters and their grandmother to Paris in celebration of their grandmother's 100th birthday. The staff of the hotel were extremely helpful in making arrangements that facilitated touring a city with a person that is 100 years old. I expected that because I have stayed there before but I was not expecting the hotel to send a bottle of champagne and roses to her room on her birthday! Rooms are small but no one should go to Paris to stay in their room.....

Reviews.Title: “Clean, central and reasonably priced”
Reviews.Author: June-francina
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for two nights with a friend in March . The staff were friendly , very helpful and spoke English. The twin room was clean and just big enough for us . We chose this hotel for it's central location as we wanted to visit the Louvre and Notre Dame which were both within reasonable walking distance. The Eiffel tower is a longer walk but this hotel is a good base for exploring Paris. We enjoyed the choice of breakfast in the hotel dining room. We found a reasonably priced restaurant/bar called Au Cadran at 1 Rue Daunou and visited the Auld Alliance pub which is not too far away. I'd have no hesitation in returning to this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “An oasis centred in great locations”
Reviews.Author: anhdis
Reviews.Content: Easy to fall in love with this hotel and its staff! A pleasent stay in a nice, clean and cozy hotel. Smal, but comfortable and nicely decorated rooms with, not at least, a decent shower, perfect! Breakfast okay, a variation of cerials, bread, fruit ect. Although, are you a coffee-lover, have a nice cup of tea instead, and wait until later with a great french roast coffee served nearby in the many cafe's around the area. For approx 150 euro you get a good value for money at this hotel, its highly recommended. We are looking foreward to our next visit to Paris where we would be staying in Grand Hotel Dechampaigne. Thanks for all. Anders & Catja

Reviews.Title: “Perfect base for exploring Paris”
Reviews.Author: weekendbreakLondon
Reviews.Content: This was our first trip to Paris. We chose this hotel after reading the reviews on this website, and we were not disappointed. The hotel is in the heart of Paris with excellent shopping oppurtunities in Rue de Rivoli, local stores such as bakeries and supermarkets as well as a tube station (Chatelet) opposite of the Hotel. The staff were very friendly and the room was very clean, cosy and with high ceilings. With the tube station and bus stops in the near vincinity as well as being within walking distance to musee du louvre and Notre Dame, this Hotel is the perfect base for exploring Paris. Highly recommendable.

Reviews.Title: “Very French boutique hotel in a great location”
Reviews.Author: MelvinKerracher
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for only one night and were very comfortable. The location is great, but tucked away down a side street which opens up to the little square with the entrance on the corner. Some other reviews have said that it's noisy, but they must have been just unlucky because it's not a noisy area. There is a lovely lobby with little bar area (combined) and another seating area attached, but I think it would only suffice for meeting others for a drink before going out. The breakfast restaurant is next to that, and breakfast is finished by 10,30hrs. We stayed on floor 6, which means one set of stairs after the lift goes to floor 5, this is easy. There are only 3 rooms up there, so it's quiet. The room was the normal Paris size, with ensuite, shower/bath, toilet and bidet. The room had an adequate wardrobe with a safe, small digital television with 10 channels including one english-language channel (CNN). The bed was firm (which I like). It was a superior room so it included tea/coffee & kettle, bathrobes with slippers and a glass of champagne each on arrival. The best thing was that the staff were lovely. Polite, professional, helpful. What's more is that they arranged non-dairy milk and breakfast items to suit my diet. There is a baggagerie (luggage room) and safe too. So far this has been the best location for us, on our 5th visit to Paris, as we were able to avoid the metro. I recommend arriving by taxi if coming by Eurostar or any main Paris terminal, it's no fun searching for hotels after a voyage which probably involves a crouded metro and dragging suitcases up stairs. You can always take the train for the way home once you have found your bearings. We only needed to use the train one other time, to go to the Catacombes. Other than that, we walked to Jardin du Luxembourg, Notre Dame, Pantheon, Opera House, Louvre and Place Vendome.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location, nice atmosphere, just like Paris itself...:)”
Reviews.Author: Mojmir_MacGyver
Reviews.Content: Very nice hotel near Louvre and Rue de Rivoli, great place if you are interested in exploring the city. All rooms have different colour and furniture solution... And of course, very good tasting breakfast:) To enjoy all food and wine advantages of Paris you really don't need to go far from the hotel, enough of great restaurants and bars near the point of your stay:)

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location for a tourist”
Reviews.Author: HUNTINGTONBEACH100
Reviews.Content: The location of this hotel is perfect for a tourist who walks around Paris most famous attraction places. The room was clean and the metro and busses were accessible within a minute walking distance. The workers were very helpful with directions and advises regarding places to visit. I love it...

Reviews.Title: “A Pearl”
Reviews.Author: IndianaDreamers
Reviews.Content: We had a wonderful stay in Paris overall. We researched to find that, with an infant, we woudl be traveling many miles by foot to see the city. So, to make it a more pleasant stay, we booked at two hotels. The first, the Eiffel Siene was a stone's throw from the Tower. We were able to walk everywhere except to the Champs because of colder temps and it being nighttime. The second half of the trip led us to the Grand Hotel. This area enabled us to walk by foot to all of our destinations once again. We enjoyed the wonderful Boulangerie just down the street on the corner of Rue Lavandieres each morning on our walk to the next sight. The staff was wonderful and the room was much more roomy than most. We were accomodated with a bigger room to hold the port-a-crib that was set up and ready when we arrived. We recommend the Cafe Le Zimmer who accomodated us with our infant and treated us all beautifully. The food was great, too. Enjoy your stay!

Reviews.Title: “Small, but Special”
Reviews.Author: NycApple
Reviews.Content: We stayed here on a 3 country visit to Europe. The hotel was small, the elevator was busted---but it was a nice hotel if you are planning on spending a lot of time outside of the hotel around town. This hotel provides everything you need for a fun Paris vacation. > Wonderful location (in the middle of town near Notre Dame). > Nice staff. They did their best to make sure we had a great time. > A cozy romantic restaurant located a few steps from the hotel (Robe et le Palais)--waiters are excellent at pairing wines with food, dessert, or whatever.

Reviews.Title: “Very friendly service - Great location”
Reviews.Author: KandKB
Reviews.Content: Excellent location (& price) for central Paris and extremely friendly and helpful staff. Many thanks The Bell Family

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant stay, excellent location, friendly service, ...”
Reviews.Author: PeteHerranen
Reviews.Content: Located almost right above the Paris metro hub, Chatelet station, You can easily get around from here. Breakfast is tasty and the rooms cozy and romantic. A good choice. The name "Grand" doesn´t come from the size but rather from the atmosphere.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel, friendley staff and a great location”
Reviews.Author: Darmah900
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for a long weekend in November 2008. Nice hotel on 5 floors accessed via a small lift, our room on the 5th floor was not large but this is Paris.... and was nicely decorated, very clean, and made you feel at home. All of the staff we met were friendly and helpful, and most spoke english. The location was great as it is 200 yards from Châtelet Metro station which has a number of lines serving it, and 1/2 mile 10 minutes from Notre Dame and about the same to the Louvre. There are plenty of good restaurants in the area and if they weren’t to your taste it was only about 15 minutes walk acros the Seine to the Latin quarter where there are loads to choose from. The continental breakfast was extra at €13.50 but was well worth it. All in all we enjoyed our stay and would recommend it highly.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient location + Helpful Staff!”
Reviews.Author: Whistlebinky
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Grand Hotel de Champaigne from 10/24/08 to 10/30/08, and had a wonderful time. The staff were very friendly and helpful, and the rooms were clean and comfortable. Also, the location of the hotel was great; not only were we within walking distance of the Louvre and Île de la Cité, we had a metro exit and a small grocery store right around the corner - very handy for some quick and cheap breakfasts. And then there's the nearby shopping and dining... you really can't go wrong with this spot! A few notes though - just as a heads up to fellow travelers, not really criticisms of the hotel itself: - The area around the hotel can get a bit noisy at night - there were almost always a few young (possibly drunk) folk carrying on in the general vicinity in the wee hours of the morning. I don't fault the hotel for the noise - they're not located smack in the middle of a bunch of clubs or anything like that. The noise is probably just people wandering home from their nights out. I'm guessing most folks would sleep right through it; however, if you're a light sleeper you might want to bring ear plugs (the same could be said of any room on the first few floors of any hotel in the heart of Paris). On the plus side, the windows do have nice heavy drapes to keep the light (and some of the sound) out when you're trying to sleep in. - If you're reading travel reviews, you've no doubt read that Parisian hotel rooms are usually small. The room we had here (a Double Superior) was a little small compared to the usual double rooms one finds in the U.S.; however, it was still quite comfortable for myself and the hubby. We ended up going with twin beds because we know that even in the U.S., sometimes "queen" beds end up being doubles instead; we both wanted some space to sleep without elbowing each other the whole time. ;-) We probably needn't have worried though, as the twin beds were a bit larger than I expected. - The bathroom is also on the small side, but workable. I should mention that I am not a "petite" person, so if I can manage in there, I bet anyone can. ;-) On the plus side, the water was almost always hot (i think my husband had maybe one instance when there wasn't quite enough hot water for him) and the shower pressure was good. Most important to us though was that the bathroom was clean, and there weren't any problems there. - Another note about the bathroom: if you like to use a face cloth or sponge to wash up, bring/buy your own. The hotel provides guests with two large bath towels and two smaller hand towels, but no face cloths. The hotel staff were also very accommodating when I asked for extra towels (and other odds and ends). - About the Metro: There is a metro stop right around the corner from the hotel at Rue Bertin Poiree. It's just for getting in and out of the metro, though - you can't buy tickets there. There's another Chatelet metro stop close to the hotel where you can buy tickets, but I'm not sure which Exit # that one was. The first time we took the metro back to the Chatelet stop to come back to the hotel, we didn't realize that there are a bunch of exits, and we got lost - I think we ended up walking towards Forum des Halles. Anyway, if you're on the metro and just want to make a beeline right to the hotel, look for the Exit for Rue Bertin Poiree!

Reviews.Title: “Very Romantic - typical Paris”
Reviews.Author: jaydeeCapeTown
Reviews.Content: Dear Madam We stayed from 17th to 25th October 2008 - Room 503. This has been our 6th stay at your hotel since 1998. We have visited Paris every two years since 1998 and only stayed at Grand Hotel de Champaigne because it is "like coming home". I even booked two of our company directors into your hotel this year and they thoroughly enjoyed their stay from 18th to 23rd October 2008. The ladies at reception Raquel / Charlotte / Nerimine and Olga are really friendly and helpful and a pleasure to deal with. The room was always impeccably clean. The overall service is the best. The location of the hotel is great - right in the centre of Paris. I highly recommend it to my colleagues & friends and look forward to my next visit in 2010, God willing. Kind regards John & Rachel Arendse Cape Town, South Africa

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel”
Reviews.Author: ast_consult
Reviews.Content: Excellent hotel. Stayed in it in September of this year. It is very conveniently located directly in the centre of Paris. A charming kind from a balcony. Convenient and cosy number (503). Qualitative and affable service. We will necessarily try to stop in this hotel yet once. Yours faithfully, Alexeenko Andrey and Ekaterina.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Joanisima
Reviews.Content: The service at the hotel was excellent, the staff is very friendly and helpfull. Very confortable rooms and always clean. Very well located, just a few steps from Louvre Museun and Notre Dame Cathedral. It's an excellent choice if you want to spend a nice time in Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Grates Hotel in Paris”
Reviews.Author: adolfer18
Reviews.Content: The hotel is excellently located in the centre, lovely Cafes around the corner and Mini Market. The personnal was very nice and cordial very nice room, good food, This is one of the best hotels in Paris that i never bin before, very close to everywhere. Very good service, and very nice enviroment good stay on my vacations thanks to all the staff.

Reviews.Title: “Charming Parisian Hotel”
Reviews.Author: ladydocBC
Reviews.Content: Very quaint, charming hotel in the heart of Paris - a block from the Seine and Pont Neuf. Rooms are small - in the usual European style. Continental breakfast (add 13.50 Euros per day)was excellent. The maid was a little slow on the uptake - empty kleenex boxes not replaced and toilettries were not replenished. We had turn-down service the first two nights and were forgotten about the next two nights! Good value for money and a perfect location. They have a laptop computer for free internet access in the lobby. (But the French keyboard will slow you down!)

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel, great location, excellent service”
Reviews.Author: Danix4u
Reviews.Content: This is one of the best hotels in Paris, very close to everywhere, very nice rooms, each room has a different flavour. Very good service, and very nice atmosphere.

Reviews.Title: “Pleased by Grand Hotel de Champaigne”
Reviews.Author: ikatsenos
Reviews.Content: The hotel is excellently located in the centre (very close to Notre Dame and the Louvre). It has easy access to the Metro, Cafes round the corner and Mini Market. The personnel was very helpful and friendly. The rooms were as in the photos (well the colors in the photos must have been enhanced with photoshop ;-) as the color of the walls are a bit faded in reallity). The important thing is that the room was clean. The bathroom was also clean and in very good condition (except of the drains which need some patience). There is airconditioning, but it is centrally controlled. Concluding the value for money is excellent (especially when breakfast is not included in price) and we 'd be glad to go again. I.K. Greece

Reviews.Title: “Must to be”
Reviews.Author: jon100
Reviews.Content: It was excellent, to be in Center of Paris and live in beatifull hotel. This hotel is an air of Paris.

Reviews.Title: “LOVED IT 100%”
Reviews.Author: nindita
Reviews.Content: This Charming lovely hotel was situated right in the middle of the Louvre, Notre Damme, the Forum de Halles, tour buses, lots of cafes and restaurants but because this hotel was tucked away from the main noisy street, it was so quiet that my children slept too much. There were 2 mini supermarkets just 1 min from the hotel so we were spoilt. We had a triple bedroom with 3 single beds, very comfortable, aircondition, excellent shower, plenty of towels and soap. The 3 receptionists and night concierge were fabulous, almost like your best friends, all of them could speak fluent English so they were able to give us lots of guidance. You could even buy your Disney ticket and day tours from the hotel. As a family of 3 where one was disabled, we thoroughly LOVED this hotel!!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: Dirk_Dewit
Reviews.Content: The location of the hotel was great. In the centre of old Paris with 'Les Halles' and plenty restaurants on walking distance. The hotel is situated in a small lane and we could sleep with the windows open. Very quiet street. Because of the heavy furniture and decoration the room looks small and dark but was big enough for both of us. The bed though was on the smallish side. They did not have smoking rooms but that is since beginning this year in all the hotels in Paris. The only thing I missed a bit was a shower curtain. The overall was very neat. The staff is very friendly and helpfull. We also could keep our luggage in the hotel after we had checked out untill we left Paris the same evening. There we still bought some stuff, we returned to the hotel several times to add some stuff to our stored luggage and the staff still helped us with a friendly smile.

Reviews.Title: “Harry Potter Special”
Reviews.Author: MNBoogie
Reviews.Content: Okay, I have very little room to complain. We made our booking late and it's extremely hard to find a great triple on such short notice. I absolutely agree that the location for this hotel is good, and of course, it's all about the location. What I would complain about is a room tucked under the stairs with virtually no windows. I know this is a very old building, but it was hard to sleep thinking about what would happen if there had been a fire!!!! The silver lining here was that we didn't suffer any of the noise other reviewers commented about in previous reviews. Two other incidents did make our stay an "average" one. We asked several times to borrow the adapter so we could recharge a cell phone, but in our three day stay, never managed to get one, even though we were assured that they had several on hand. We also asked for wake-up calls (must get in line early to avoid huge summer lines at Versailles) and on both mornings they never came. (Too bad for us....3+ hours on line in the sun on a Saturday. If only we'd been able to use the alarm on the phone we couldn't recharge!) I would probably look for a different hotel in a similar location if I had the time and energy to do so.

Reviews.Title: “excellent location, friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: kd147
Reviews.Content: Excellent location. Friendly staff. Room size typical of Paris - but very nicely furnished and decor very in keeping with the premises. We would definitely book here again.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Hotel - INCREDIBLE LOCATION”
Reviews.Author: DaveIsTravelling
Reviews.Content: We stayed here in June/July 2008 for just over a week, after booking online. GREAT CHOICE! The staff were very friendly and helpful, and even got us a lunch reservation at the Jules Verne restaurant in the Eiffel Tower, and were always ready with suggestions or directions when we needed them. The room was beautiful, and the housekeeping service did a great job and even turned down our bed at night if they saw us go out for dinner. There's even free Wifi throughout the hotel. Our room (107) was very nice, though the shower would be tight for anyone over 5'10" and 170 lbs, but I understand that's not uncommon for Parisian hotels. As great as the hotel itself is, the best feature has to be the location. It's only a walk of minutes to the Louvre, Musee d'Orsay, Pont Neuf bridge, Latin Quarter, Notre Dame, National Opera House, Luxembourg Garden, metro... We spent every day seeing the city and did most of our travel by foot from the hotel. We didn't eat at the hotel so I can't comment on the restaurant, though it seemed to be busy every morning. Overall, a GREAT choice and we'll definitely be back. The hotel and service were great and the location is unbeatable.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Hotel in a Charming Parisian Neighborhood”
Reviews.Author: funkimonki
Reviews.Content: I loved everything about this hotel! The staff were all wonderful and extremely helpful. The rooms are so cute and quite spacious for Paris. Though the hotel is located in the middle of all the action, it is actually on a very quite street, so there is very little noise regardless which side your room faces. There are also a bunch of bistros just outside the hotel, and it is served by a well-connected metro station. I loved my stay here and will definitely return. Next month, as a matter of fact!

Reviews.Title: “Strongly Recommended!”
Reviews.Author: B_you
Reviews.Content: I liked the hotel very much. The location is excellent, the rooms are unique in design, free wifi access, very helpful staff and great breakfast. Strongly recommended. Only comment is the mattress which was a bit old and should be replaced.

Reviews.Title: “Charming hotel!”
Reviews.Author: tancook
Reviews.Content: Lovely hotel in the heart of Paris. Fantastic location, within walking distance to most major attractions. The hotel is very clean and well-maintained with charming decor and warm and friendly staff who make you feel welcome. Highly recommended - I would definitely stay there again!

Reviews.Title: “We had a great stay!”
Reviews.Author: glenviewtoparis
Reviews.Content: We had several recommendations from friends where to stay, but opted to take a chance here. The reviews sounded quite positive and convincing. We were not disappointed. The room was small but very clean,and we were able to store our luggage. The shower was hot with great water pressure, but it was a handheld shower which makes a quick shower difficult. The location could not be beat! We were able to walk so many places and the Metro access was right nearby. The location was quiet because it was tucked in just off the beaten path. The staff was the best part! They were able to help us find our way anywhere and made great recommendations for dinner. I truly believe they made our stay as pleasurable as it was! We also appreciated the internet access on the hotel laptop. Leaving our children home was difficult, though we were able to maintain contact via email at no extra charge

Reviews.Title: “Fab location”
Reviews.Author: EdinburghFamilyof3
Reviews.Content: It was the perfect location for us as we were looking for a convienent stop in the heart of Paris before we moved on to Disneyland. The room was small but clean and the beds were very comfy. We had a room for three and we all had a comfortable night. My only moan would be the lack of a decent shower as it was one of those hold in your hand jobs - however the pressure was good.

Reviews.Title: “Great ambience, great value”
Reviews.Author: amantidella
Reviews.Content: Reviewer: P&G ,Toronto Ontario Grand Hotel de Champaigne is a hidden gem in the heart of Paris. It is ideally situated near the Seine ,the Louvre, Georges Pompidou, Notre Dame, the Marais,other major attractions and routes, etc, etc.. Yet, it is tucked away from busy main streets and their night noise.We booked on the spur of the moment and found the staff to be most friendly ,receptive and extremely helpful.Many little details have been thought of and the amenities exceed those we have experienced in comparably priced hotels in Paris .We've stayed at 2 other smaller hotels in the proximate area over the last year and this hotel has now become our first choice .We have already recommended it to friends planning a visit to Paris later this year.

Reviews.Title: “excellent location!”
Reviews.Author: mootikUK
Reviews.Content: Very helpful and polite staff. Absolutely ideal central location near the main attractions. The rooms are tiny, but nice and clean.

Reviews.Title: “great location”
Reviews.Author: judydau
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this lovely ,charming hotel april 9-15th,2008. The location was ideal.every nite we would walk for hours thru the marais, notre dame ,along the seine,everywhere. the weather held up and some rain never stopped us,especially when we finally learned to navigate the metro.Just a hint: when boarding the metro,especially if very crowded,make sure your spouse makes it on with you.My husband ended up waving to me from the outside as the car left the station.I had a little adventure finding my way back to the hotel.luckily i had euros and a card with the hotel's name on it.i also found the french very helpful when asking for directions.it helps to know a few phrases in french! Breakfast was included for us as I had booked during an internet special,otherwise it was 13.5 euros each. We found the staff very helpful,especially charlotte.The few minor inconveniences we encountered were not a big problem: the garbage trucks do come about 7:50am,but we needed to get up then anyway.the lighting in the bathroom was poor and i do prefer a shower to a bathtub which I should have requested. we would stay here again,except we prefer to try out new neighborhoods each time. The rooms are very small,but you will not regret this hotel choice. judy daugherty

Reviews.Title: “Very pleasant stay”
Reviews.Author: SusanM
Reviews.Content: I've stayed in a few typical Parisien hotels over the last few years and found this one to be one of the better ones. We enjoyed our stay. Myself and my husband stayed here for a weekend. Briefly: Very centrally located. We could walk to the Louvre and St. Germaine de Prez, and to the George Pompidou Center. Staff were very pleasant and courteous. Reception - clean, pleasant, plenty of brochures Hotel Room - clean, unusual decor - medieval style (?), clean linen and towels, clean bathroom, supplied with soap, shampoo, disposable razor, toothpaste, shoe shine, shower cap. Plenty of tea and coffee. Towelling robes and slippers supplied also. Fridge with drinks and food.

Reviews.Title: “Something need to improve”
Reviews.Author: butterflywu
Reviews.Content: We are very enjoy our stay except our room have no boiler . Although, the staff had explained to us said only the deluxe room have it, but still no hot water in the room it is very not convenience. Better have the boiler in each room , this is the minium requirement.

Reviews.Title: “Location, location, location...”
Reviews.Author: Travelling_gaijin
Reviews.Content: Location was outstanding, a block from the Seine river in between the Lourve and Notre Dame and next to the Metro. Easy train ride from CDG airport to Chaltelet Les Halles on RER and a short walk to the Metro exit, Rue Rivoli. Staff was outstanding, very knowledgable and directions were very good. The room was small and dated, the disappointment of the hotel, but hopefully you're not in the room much and it was clean. Breakfast was average for 13 Euro, but you can't beat the convenience factor. Highlights were location and staff. The room (we were on the 5th floor) and breakfast can be improved. Tip: the restaurants adjacent to the hotel were expensive, try the Au Vieux Chatelet at 1 Place Du Chatelet next to the fountain on the river. Food was reasonable and escargot & champaign were excellent. I would stay again if I got a good deal.

Reviews.Title: “Sweet and Rustic”
Reviews.Author: Boingy_breaks
Reviews.Content: Well placed small hotel with some charm - within walking distance of lots of must see Paris sights and on the doorstep of Chatelet, one of the best connected metro stations. Sweet room with rustic feel. Perfectly acceptable for short stay, adequate facilities, even a sprinkling of romance - we arrived on Valentines to find heart shaped lollipops on our pillows. Room cosy, the important things clean - bed, bath, toilet but dusty skirting boards etc that you wouldn't call immaculate. Bed a bit soft for my taste. Slightly annoying recurring buzzing in the hall way that we joked was our own personal quiz show. Slightly annoying non-replinishment of minibar and teabags! Other then that friendly and helpful staff and very welcoming. Have placed above average because for the hotel class and price in comparison to other Parisian establishments I think it does well.

Reviews.Title: “Best location ever!”
Reviews.Author: Shauli
Reviews.Content: The hotel is close to everywhere! the staff is very helpful and we could leave the suitcase for couple of hours after the checkout time. the room are a bit small but we did came to spend our vication in the room so it was OK by us!

Reviews.Title: “Weekend break staying at the Grand Hotel de Champaigne”
Reviews.Author: LondonersUK
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 2 nights and were pleased with our choice of hotel. It's perfectly located to get around the city, lots of restaurants within walking distance and the rooms were clean and comfortable. Loved the deep long bath! Yes, the lift is tiny but that's all part of the Parisien charm of the place!

Reviews.Title: “Close to everything!”
Reviews.Author: jester7107
Reviews.Content: This is a great hotel for the price. It's 2 blocks from the metro, within walking distance of the Louvre and Notre Dame, and surrounded by shopping and dining locations. Our bed was actually comfortable and the room very clean. The best part of the hotel is the staff. I heard a least 4 different languages spoken. Everyone was very friendly and willing to help. We didn't try the breakfast buffet as it was 13 Euros and there were so many cheaper options nearby. The shower was small but it was clean and had awesome water pressure. I would definately reccommend this hotel to a friend.

Reviews.Title: “Charming Staff”
Reviews.Author: Elena01462
Reviews.Content: This is a charming hotel in a great location with superb staff. Of course the rooms are small, but no one who travels regularly should be surprised, given the central location and great price, and the size of the rooms was more than adequate for sleeping, lovemaking, and checking email! The very special aspect of this hotel is the wonderful staff. Every day one of them recommended a different restaurant, made dinner reservations for us, and gave us good directions on how to get there. All of their recommendations were superb. Overall this hotel is a great value.

Reviews.Title: “Exactly what we were looking for”
Reviews.Author: London018
Reviews.Content: We booked a triple room for a weekend away in January and found this place to be perfect for what we were looking for. A good basic hotel that was in a good location and not too expensive. Given that we did not spend large amounts of time in our room and were prepared for paris-sized rooms, we found our room to be adequately sized for the three of us to move around without tripping over each other. The decor added to atmosphere and although there was no views from our window (except that of the wall opposite) we found the room to be very quiet. The staff were helpful and polite and allowed me to practice my poor french skills with them. We did not eat breakfast in the hotel as there were numerous bistro's nearby. The location is excellent being close to the Louvre and Notre Dame and easy access to the metro and RER systems. If coming back to Paris I would book this hotel and recommend it to others travelling to Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly and efficient staff”
Reviews.Author: Michel_Leclerc
Reviews.Content: I studied in Paris in the 70s, and, though in love with the city and its riches, had grown "accustomed" in the 80s and 90s to service levels below par and Parisian "arrogance". In the last ten years all that changed, it seems. Paris has become open, friendly, multilingual. The staff of this hotel proved that right. In the booking process there was a small problem due to a mistake I made, and they graciously and highly efficiently corrected that. The friendliness and efficiency of the staff just beamed across the counter when I arrived. I was not a difficult customer, I have to admit, but everything was done so as to make checking in, and out, smooth and fast. As for the rooms, I have noticed that some customers complained about their size. Though I appreciate spacious rooms in other cities, I know that I don't have to expect that in Paris. The square meter cost at the hotel's location near Town Hall and the Notre Dame is just too high for that. I appreciated the lay-out of the rooms on the floors. It is clear they made a maximum use of space available, but it was anyhow sufficient. Besides, I do not expect to live in my hotel room when I am in Paris. Cleanliness, bathroom facilities, all that was excellent. Wallpaper etc. showed a slightly old-fashioned, almost British taste -- but I liked the peace it gave. No fancy furniture show here. I am always very apprehensive of noise in hotels (coming from neighboring venues, streets, but especially the elevators...) ...and though I was located on the 4th floor next to the elevator, I did not hear a sound and slept to my content. I did not take their breakfast as any Paris bistrot or brasserie well chosen can offer them as tasty I suppose, and with the view on the Seine, Conciergerie, or the Halles as a bonus. I am definitely going back to this hotel. Its location is just perfect. Michel Leclerc, Brussels

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, bad mattresses”
Reviews.Author: copa777
Reviews.Content: In a nutshell, here are the positives: 1) excellent location; very near Notre Dame and the Louvre, on an extremely quiet street (practically an alley; no noise) 2) room rates were very good by Paris standards 3) nice front desk staff Negatives: 1) I have a bad back, and the mattress was not firm enough. It didn't seem like a poor quality mattress, just not really comfortable. For me, this is the most important aspect of the hotel. The hotel could be 100% improved with better mattresses. 2) Rooms are small. 3) No mini fridge; bad if you like keeping beverages or even having some snacks

Reviews.Title: “Unsafe Hotel, Rude Staff”
Reviews.Author: DLAlabama
Reviews.Content: As noted in several previous reports the hotel features: small rooms, tiny showers, and an adjacent noisy alley populated with alcoholics and smelling like urine. Now I frequently stay in New Orleans, so drunks, alleys,the scent of urine and small rooms don't typically bother me. What DOES bother me is nasty staff. Oh yeah, and the garbage truck that came rolling down the alley at 0630hrs, waking up the whole place. (well documented in previous reviews) At this hotel, when you leave for the day, you are supposed to leave your key at the desk, when you get back you ask for your key back by room number. The problem is: They don't check ID, you say a number and they hand out a (random?) key. One night I was given the wrong key, which I realized when I made it back up to my room. I'm pretty sure I told him the correct room number and I was apolegetic when I informed the night man of the mistake. (Je suis désolée...) He still BERATED me for taking the wrong key, which was the one he GAVE me!!!!! I've previously worked security for a major hotel chain and both from a security and a customer service perspective this experience was a disaster! It's a shame because aside from this individual and the day manager (who was simply indifferent), the remainder of the staff was super nice. If you like alcoholics, dark alleys, early morning wakeup calls from garbage trucks, tiny rooms, lax security and a very nasty staff member, the Grand Hotel de Champaigne is for you! Otherwise keep looking!

Reviews.Title: “Plenty of Reasons to Come Back”
Reviews.Author: Lenore2
Reviews.Content: I just returned from Paris and my fourth or fifth stay at this delightful little hotel. Obviously, I like it a lot. Once again, I found the staff to be warm, friendly and helpful. My room was charming and had a brand-new bathroom (a little small, but very bright and clean). I like the hotel's location, tucked in a quiet little corner of "old Paris" just a very few minutes from the Louvre, Notre Dame and literally steps away from the Chatelet Metro stop . . . and several Metro and RER lines (including RER Line B to Charles de Gaulle Airport). Over the six or seven years since I first became acquainted with the hotel, the management has made many improvements, including air conditioning and flat panel TVs. But the charming, distinctly Parisian look and feeling of the place has been meticulously maintained.

Reviews.Title: “My mother loved it!”
Reviews.Author: BayBoyHDG
Reviews.Content: My partner and I stayed here with my mother last May (2007). A wonderful find - minutes from the Seine, Les Halle, Notre Dame, Rue de Rivoli, the Marais. Rooms are nicely appointed and reasonably-sized, for Paris. There are no great views as it is located off an alley/side street. We did not try the breakfast but the coffee service was quick and the coffee strong. There were plenty of boulangeries and patisseries in the neighborhood. A block away on the Seine are many flower and garden shops. The street was in full bloom when we visited. Walk a few blocks west and you are in the middle of the Marais - great for shopping and dining. The Centre Pompidou is close by, the Picasso Museum a bit further (25 minute walk if you can resist all the sights and shops along the way). The front desk staff were always helpful and spoke English cheerfully and well. They made several restaurant reservations for us. My partner and I had a street-side room and did not notice a problem with noise. Then again, there is always the chance of a few late night revelers - something impossible to avoid in most large cities. My mother had an inside room that looked onto an air shaft with a quaint garden at the bottom - no complaints from Mom! Highly recommended!

Reviews.Title: “Paris in the Dark”
Reviews.Author: WoodstockIreland
Reviews.Content: Overall I was disappointed with my stay. The hotel literature promised so much and perhaps fell prey to over promise and definite under delivery. The room (standard double) was small but clean and adequate. The staff attitude was polite and profession but only that there was little warmth or effort beyond the minimum. During my 3 night stay the electricity went off on a number of occasions while I was in the hotel, possibly more while I was out. Whatever the reason for these outages, I was never notified by the staff, there was no apology and certainly no effort at assessing if the outages either disturbed me or were impacting my stay in Paris! On one occasion on returning to the hotel in the evening I was locked out and faced with a hand written sign taped to the glass door indicating that someone would be back in 5 minutes. After 10 mins I gained entry! For location benefits the hotel is excellent in all other respects it is a disappointment. This hotel cannot be considered value for money based on my experience. If you choose to stay there I hope your experience is better than mine.

Reviews.Title: “Charm and a fabulous location”
Reviews.Author: Ready2Go2008
Reviews.Content: This hotel is a real find, and has been listed in "Hotels de Charmes". It is a 5 minute walk to either the Louvre or Notre Dame. Built in 1562, and furnished in the style of Louis XIII and both charming and comfortable. Full service breakfast is about 12-15 Euros, but if you want a continental breakfast there are 'tea rooms" on the corner. Staff is very helpful, and there is a pc available in the lobby (tho' it tends to develop a line.) Rooms are typically small for central Paris, but price is reasonable and experience is top drawer.

Reviews.Title: “Special Hotel in the Heart of Paris”
Reviews.Author: 4paw
Reviews.Content: What a wonderful gem tucked away in the heart of Paris!!! This small, quaint hotel is full of the ambiance that I think one would expect of a small European hotel. Upon entering the hotel, I found the lobby to be quite inviting with French decor and a very friendly staff. The larger hotels that I considered, appeared bland, void of character and looked like any other large hotel anywhere in the world. The breakfast area at Grand Hotel de Champagne is intimate and bids you to sit and relax. An array of cooked and cold breakfast foods are offered in the morning. The decor speaks of Provence, colors of yellow and red. My room, although small, was equipped with all amenities...and my room was AIR CONDITIONED(not the norm in most of the smaller hotels in Paris).!!! The Grand Hotel de Champagne is located in a great area....within walking distance of the Marais shopping district, rue de Rivoli, close to the Louvre art museum. The room charge was very reasonable. The staff was also helpful in confirming my return flight via internet at the front desk.. I would highly recommend this hotel to anyone who is looking for quaintness, friendly/helpful staff, price, value and location. The elevator and rooms are somewhat small, but all of the other aspects were a plus for me.

Reviews.Title: “Location, location, location.”
Reviews.Author: offlin
Reviews.Content: Highly Recommend. (see photo) We left de Gaulle, dragging our two suitcases behind us, taking the "B" train (for only 11e) to Chatelet les Halles, a station just three blocks away from the GH de Champ. We were accompanied by a very friendly ex-pat whom we met on the train (Roberta) who gave us some quick advice regarding our first trip to Paris. Have fun! Less than one hour after touchdown we were standing at the reception of GHdeChampagne. My french being poor at best, we were pleased that every staff member we spoke with knew some English. (Of course, being a polite and civilized person, I attempted some french first, Savez-La?) The rooms were, as me Aunt Mim would say, "cute," as in "smallish," but we wanted a place to sleep, not play raquetball. My wife pointed out that the four seasons we stayed at in NYC fourty-two floors above bleeping traffic (à 4am) in a similar-sized room cost 426 binks a nite. Did I mention that the Parisians don't use their car horns? Try to notice how many times you hear a horn. We heard five in three days. It won't keep you up at night. Back to the Hotel. It was absolutely clean, and Rugby was on the Satellite and the bed was nice and firm...sleeping was easy. But don't sleep!!! You are in Paris, and things are going on all the time. This is where this hotel really shines. Location, location and location. Consider: Walking, Chatelet les Halles: 5 min Le Louvre 5 min Le Tour Eiffel < 1 km Notre Dame de Paris 5 min Dining 15 restaurants w/ in a three-wood range. And much more. Just Google Earth it. Again, I highly recommend. Paul Lakewood, OH

Reviews.Title: “Great Location!”
Reviews.Author: HeatherG55
Reviews.Content: Spent two nights here. Great location, can walk to most sights. Hotel staff were friendly and very helpful. The rooms are quaint and clean. I would stay here again for the location. Located on a quiet street, that can be a bit hard to hard since it is tucked away.

Reviews.Title: “Beware the Moulin Rouge”
Reviews.Author: Yorkdog
Reviews.Content: The staff was very friendly and made us feel welcome. Great location. Clean rooms but old furnishings......... We went to the Moulin Rouge.......Want to warn everyone how horrible it was. DISGUSTING food LAME show ..........

Reviews.Title: “I recommend”
Reviews.Author: Katjax1
Reviews.Content: Excellent location and very nice and helpful staff at the reception. I was upgraded upon arrival, so I got a room with a balcony with a view. What a pleasant surprise! Room was nicely decorated and was of standard size. And what best: staying in the heart of the city but getting a decent sleep -no noice from the street. I recommed this hotel to everyone who wants a good hotel with moderate price and excellent location.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Location”
Reviews.Author: goldenlandtraveller
Reviews.Content: My friends and I stayed at the Grand Hotel de Champagne and we were completely satisfied. The hotel is beautiful, the rooms were excellent and the breakfast was first class. In addition, the staff were extremely helpful, polite and friendly. I strongly recommend anyone wanting to stay in Paris to stay here. The location is fabulous, right next to the Rue du Rivoli, walking distance to all the wonderful sights and museums of Paris, including the marvellous Louvre. The ambience is friendly and comfortable and homely, not cold and unfriendly as most of the big chains of hotels are. I strongly recommend this fabulous hotel.

Reviews.Title: “A place to be in Paris”
Reviews.Author: Aparislover
Reviews.Content: Nearby the important museums of Paris, for example the Louvre, Musee d'Orsay, Picasso, Pompidou you find this excellent hotel. Friendly staff, extraordinary rooms. A hotel to remember for the next visit to Paris.

Reviews.Title: “best location possible, excellent personnel, small but tasteful rooms”
Reviews.Author: sepHolland
Reviews.Content: were there with 4 (two kids and parent) at two rooms. Location is unbelievable: can't be more central but at a very quiet street. Personnel is very friendly and had everything covered, including parking space etc. Prices are reasonably, especially for the location. Would recommend it to my best friends without hesitation and would surely go back there. Rooms were small and shower was small but only a problem for very fat people..

Reviews.Title: “Boutique Hotel”
Reviews.Author: tiger911
Reviews.Content: Great hotel, very good location, friendly staff. Recommend this hotel.
